text: I've been to Italy and while this gelato isn't exactly authentic, it's good. Prices are a little high (it is after all yet another "Shoppes" area of a high-end casino), at $5.50 for a single scoop, you have to expect better. The service wasn't great either. I went twice and, each time, not ONE of the five staff behind the counter greets or even acknowledges you. There is a sign stating where the line begins, but it's next to a column that, when the store gets busy, really does nothing to help the line form. On my second visit 12/28/12 at 11:00pm, we ordered a crepe but were rudely told by the girl behind the counter, "we don't make crepes no more tonight"...ciao honey

Stopped in here while walking by one morning because we saw signs for crepes and smoothies.  When I tried to order my crepe and smoothie they got my smoothie order wrong.  That alone would have been fine, but when I pointed out to them that that was not what I ordered they called me a liar.  Another staff had to step in to tell the girl behind the register to back down and make me what I asked for.

The crepe wasn't bad, the fruit on top was good.  The smoothie actually wasn't great, I asked for some kind of mango smoothie, the wrong one they made me was strawberry and after drinking the mango one I wished I'd have taken the first one they made me.

Don't recall exactly what I paid but it felt steep for what it was, pretty meh food, and unprofessional service get 2 stars in my book.

I work at the Palazzo/Venetian Casino in one of the shoppes here. So this is my everyday cafe. I eat here everyday even on my days off. It's always super clean, and I'm never disappointed when  I leave this place. This food is delicious, I've had they're wraps, sandwiches, and pizzas. They're coffee is just impeccable!!

    I notice people are complaining about the prices...Seriously? It's in Las Vegas, NV, one of the top tourist locations in the WORLD. It's also located in a Hotel/Casino, its like buy something at an airport. Also, the Casino is located ON THE STRIP. But, I'm just saying. I've only lived here all my life....

    And that guy who mentioned that illy is cheaper in Italy, well no crap Sherlock. Of course it will be more expensive some where else because it is imported. It's like whole sale, you buy a bulk of something then you sale it at a price where you can make profit, enough profit where you can buy some more product and to keep for your company; to pay your employees and the bills etc... Come on you're running a business, that location at the Palazzo was just not given to them with free rent...

    And of course its called Espressamente illy, its an illy company, concentrating on illy coffee. All the pastries they order from a restaurant at the Palazzo, and as well as the gelato. You can't blame the cafe for it not being good that day. 
    For the people complaining about it being to busy, you have to notice that the cafe is right by a convention center...Of course it will be busy.

    As for the coffee.. It will depend on the Barista who makes it for you. All of the employees might be briefly trained about the machines, but you can't expect them to make it all the same. For the original Baristas, it not only depends on how they make the coffee but the way the calibrated the machines as well. 

The Barista's I recommend: Guillermo, Jennifer, and Samuel..

    And if you just think that illy coffee just does not taste good, read they're mission statement..  (illy.com)

    And please don't think that because I work at the shoppes that I'm just making it up, I've actually started coming to this cafe way before I started working at the Palazzo/Venetian shoppes..
When I first came here this place was really nice, clean and inviting. Now it's not clean, hand prints everywhere, unfriendly service. It was disappointing.

If you enjoy real coffee, and not those ridiculous concoctions they make at places like starbucks that happen to have a shot of espresso mixed in, then this place is coffee heaven on earth for you.  Order a double machiato caldo. You'll thank me later.

Unless you like your crepes really plain - don't bother with this place. The price is just not worth it. $9 for a mixed berry crepe with three SMALL pieces of berries. There were a few crepes laid out for examples, and I thought the fruit on some of them were just for decoration because there was just so little. Hahaha, no. 

If you want gelato, I reccommend that little gelato stand in the Canals instead. I've stayed at the Venetian and Palazzo around 5 times combined in the past year and I ALWAYS get the mango sorbet from that stand. It's so light and fluffy, and so sweet, and omg I WANT IT NOW.

I think this place was so confusing! There was a big crowd here and we wanted gelato, but the hec if we knew where the line was. Apparently you have to pay first and get a receipt and then go to the gelato counter and hand them your receipt and order your gelato. First off, there are no signs that say line forms here and there is no place that says pay first. So everyone is trying to order and they are told nope, go back and pay first, then come back. That's just a waste of their time and my time. Don't you think? My lemon gelato wasn't even worth the crowd. The plus is that they have other food to order and espresso.

This place gives Illy a bad name... poor service, the barista lack knowledge and skill... and it makes me want to buy them a cup of cappuccino and ask them if this is really what they want to serve to their customers, and then leave before I hear their response. 

I love Illy coffee beans (I brew it everyday at home) but this experience was a sad disappointment. 

If you're going to try it despite my warning, good luck! I hope the odds are in your favor. Also, they charge for Dine-In "service"...

yum yum. I wish they would open more of these in the US. Warning: its expensive, even by vegas standards, but if you love coffee, The americanos here will make you realize how bad the US chains are (starbucks and peets). Gelato do die for, and lots and lots of sugar free options (you would never ever guess they are in fact sugar free). Its just about the best gelato ive had outside of Milan -- didnt have the crepes, and seems on here, many not to thrilled with them but for insane good coffee and frozen treats, this is the BOMB. Well worth it.

Amazing selection of gelatos!

You know the expression "your eyes are bigger than your stomach"? Well, everytime I go into an ice cream parlor and see a looonnngg stretch of various flavors, I get excited and start imagining getting a multiscoop behemoth to eat. All by myself, too!

The gelato counter is the first thing you see from the entrance, and all the bright colors are just dazzling. Once you get over the hypnotic display, you take a closer look and realize just how many different flavors there are.

I was torn between the amaretto or the tiramisu flavors, but ended going with the tiramisu because it had a certain "bite" to it. In fact, I wouldn't be surprised if it was laced with a bit of marsala or some other alcohol =).  I only got one scoop because I was full from dinner, and I was a bit startled by the sticker shock. Almost $6 for one scoop??

Then, I got the scoop and it was pretty big. In fact, my single scoop almost looked like the size of my friend's double scoop! 

The gelato itself was definitely rich and creamy; everything you look for in a good gelato. It had tons of flavor (along with the "kick" mentioned earlier). I would definitely recommend that you try out the tiramisu flavor if you stop by.  Also, a single scoop is definitely enough for one person, because I couldn't even finish mine completely (and I can eat a whole Ghirardelli's Square sundae by myself).  However, I think that is due to the richness of the gelato itself.
Crispy flakey lovely croissant!! Decent coffee, but compared to the rest around  its the the really nice!

OH MY, HAVE MERCY, THIS PLACE IS HEAVEN!!

My husband and I stayed at the Palazzo just this past weekend and I was totally craving gelato. And what do I see on the corner next to the shoppes.. THIS HEAVENLY GELATO SHOPPE.

Let me just tell you- FLAVORS GALORE!! I couldnt pick! I must have tried almost every sample and they were all so heavenly. And because of the many flavors, for a quick second I was truly disappointed that on their pricing menu they only priced 1 or 2 flavors (thinkin to myself, but what if I wanted 3 flavors?). So that disappointment quickly ended when I saw the person in front of me order two scoops- their scoops were HUGE! Of all the gelato places I've been here in SD, theyve typically given us miniature scoops in a cute little bowl. Ooh haayL not here buddy, they were super generous!!

Since we just had italian food, I didnt wanna go too crazy with all the different flavors they had so I chose Pistachio and Hazelnut and oh my goodness, it definitely hit the spot.

From now on, this will be a MUST STOP for me everytime I head out that way. I HIGHLY recommend you try this place- Im tellin you, its truly worth your time.

But then again, its just my opinion.
Ordered an iced latte here... it tasted like an iced coffee? Slightly disappointed in the taste.

Their panini was surprisingly delightful! Ordered the prosuitto with mozzarella and tomato. Bread was nicely toasted, crispy on outside and warm and delectable on the inside. Comes with side of potato chips.

This Italian Gelato Panini Express cafe was better than expected.
Unfriendly place. Chicken Caesar salad is terrible. Dry chicken breast. Spoil lettuces. Couldn't finish the shit at all.

While the entire casino waits in long line for dinner at restaurants, this place is empty (!) and has all the causal meals you need like salads and sandwiches. And you get delicious Italian ice for dessert
This place is perfect! Yummy desserts and amazing coffee. Staff also very nice. Been there both on weekday and weekend, can get extremely busy/crowed on the weekends.

If you're an Aussie looking for a decent coffee in Vegas go here to Espressamente Illy. Owned & Made by an Italian, they added an extra shot or two until I was satisfied with my Latte. Hubby happy with his "wet"Cappuccino, as they are called in USA. Staff were all extremely nice, friendly & only too happy to cater to your needs. Pastries were good too. Thanks again for making our Vegas stay happy with your coffee!!!
Coffee making as a craft. Perfectly made latte and excellent pastries. The Yorkdale location brings a lot of craziness and commotion but still worth a visit.
The service is pretty subpar and the prices are pretty expensive but the pineapple tropical smoothie is amazing! It taste like a dole whip from Disneyland!

Illy always has the best coffee...I mean, it's the best I've ever had. Who wouldn't love Italian coffee? The cappuccino was pretty expensive though. 

My rating is based strictly on my experience with the coffee. I haven't had the opportunity to try the pastries or gelato. Of all coffee places on the strip, I would say this is THE place I'd go for a cappuccino.
Coffee is delicious staff is rude. I felt like I was irritating the worker.  Sad because this is the main reason I stay at the Venetian.
Ham Omelette was fantastic and could feed two people. The coffees were interesting -different than what expected. Would return for the omelette
My go-to place for a quick coffee or a gelato. Lines are usually short and there are always seats. Prices are a bit high. Service is okay.

The staff would benefit from customer service training. They can start with the basics - please and thank you, oh and a smile would be great!  Particularly since I'm paying double CA prices! I asked for a double espresso and while I have the quantity, it lacks the quality. Despite as a general rule that a double shot has more room for error than a single, not in my case.
@ $12.71 for two double shots, you decide.

Amazing big coffee shop in Yorkdale mall, they serve a lot of unique coffee specialty drinks and nice desserts as well. The cafe has wonderful seating including a big balcony where you can oversee the mall. Give their 5 grain muffins a try as well as their ice cream coffees. The traffic flow could use some work at illy as even with a small amount of people it got a little slow and confusing. This place is comparable to somewhere like Aroma or Starbucks.

Cozy and convenient. Awesome frozen treats come in a tantalizing variety. However, the sandwiches and salads are premade and a bit stale, dry and/or wilted by early evening. 

Coffee is excellent--robust, hot, smooth.

My bf and I are HUGE fans of their tiramisu here and since I had major cravings for it last night, the guy decided to take me here. They had a decent amount of people standing in line for the gelato, but none waiting to get coffee or the other desserts. I was greeted by a cashier that looked, spoke, and acted like she had a horrible day..which I totally understood. But then she decided it was okay to take it out on us. We ordered two tiramisus and a bottle of water, and I was suppose to order a cappuccino but before I finished my sentence, she walked away. That turned me off so I decided not to order it anymore. I gave her the cash, she gave me the change back, I smiled and said thank you. And she still looked at me like I owe her money! 

I've been here several times and have been dealt by the same cashier before, but I never minded her attitude because the food made up for it. I thought one time, eh..ok she deserves another chance. But another time is  another story. Anyway, the food and coffee here are still good so I only reduced it down from 5 to 4 stars. I love love love that tiramisu!!

The coffee here is really good! I had a Hot Vanilla Latte which beat Starbucks by far. I had it 2 days in a row and both times it was good and not burnt. With other coffee shops, it can be a hit or miss with burnt coffee which is not good.

Illy is up there for me as one of my favorite espresso brands of all times, so I was really looking forward to coming here for Affogato. So, I had the affogato last week with vanilla gelato and it was super disappointing with bland gelato and a measly portion as well. My friend got the heath cookie gelato and it was also super bland and unfortunate. The illy espresso was tasty, but that was a given. This place was overpriced, which is to be expected in Vegas,  and I wouldn't have minded if it actually tasted good! I felt like I had wasted money and calories and it totally wasn't worth it. I should have just gotten the straight up espresso and would have walked away happy.
Coffee was good, a bit pricey but understandable since its located inside the hotel , service was bad, rude lady in the cashier.. should be trained for hospitality!! Isnt it a hospitality bussiness?
I only vouch for their coffee... Love the sourly taste of the illy coffee and if u like special espresso drink, go for "amore" :)

THIS IS ACTUALLY ONE OF THE  REASONS THAT I LOVE TO STAY AT PALLAZZO. They have a drink called amore with an espresso shot at the bottom with some non alcoholic liquor and heavy cream at the top so essentially the drink looks black and white. Also I had an affigato here which was to die for.

Horrific service. Paid $9 for a bagel sandwich and was offered no choice of bagel. The cashier decided I was having sesame. When my order came up, along with my husbands (he was only allowed a plain bagel) and some other dude's, I tried to ask which one was mine. She just screamed "ARE YOU TOGETHER OR NOT??". I had to open some strangers coffee to try and figure out if it was my latte or not. $19 for a latte and a bagel sandwich, neither of which was very good.  I'm telling you, never again.
Rude service by one of the staff was unnecessary for an early Saturday morning. Croissants made up for it.

The cashier lady was very nice and sweet but horrible attitude from the almost bald gentleman who calls the names and hand over the orders. Please learn that you are here to serve your customers so leave the attitude at home.
The staff looks miserable working there, but the gelatos are yummy so I keep going back!

Came here for the crepes after reading some other good reviews. I wasn't impressed. I had the banana, strawberry, chocolate crepe. It wasn't bad, I mean put those three together and anything will taste good. But it wasn't spectacular. The crepes were too thick for me and didn't taste fresh. Honestly, I like the crepes at ihop better and they are half the cost. I wouldn't come again for the crepes. The coffee was decent.
Good espresso but $4 for a single seems a little pricey even for Vegas. Service wasn't great either, the employees got through the line quickly enough but they weren't too friendly while doing so!

We always stop here for some gelato and crepe whenever we are staying at the Palazzo.  We just love everything about this plac and had been a loyal customer for more than 5 years.  Price is a little pricey being in a classy hotel but well worth it.

I was really excited to try this place as it was highly recommended by a friend.  It's located on the first floor of the Venetian in a great location.

Unfortunately, I came away a little disappointed.  The specialty coffees are served European style in small cups.  I tried one of the specialty coffee and thought is was ok.  

I also had the hazelnut gellato:  too grainy and a little powdery.  The mango gellato that our son tried was better but the consistency was akin to sorbet.

For the price, even for Vegas, I expected better.

I stopped in for a quick expresso. I waited behind the counter for a few minutes while two employees carried out a conversation in Spanish. They glanced at me a few times before one of them finally acknowledged me and said "go down there bud" as he motioned with his head. I found this to be extremely rude. A normal response would have been something like "Hello, how are you? Sorry, this register is closed, we can take care of you down there." 

I go to the next counter and they don't follow me down to offer service (like ten feet). The other two employees behind the counter are also chatting and joking about something very loudly and completely ignoring the five of us waiting. One of them had a mohawk. Being in a hurry it this should have been a quick stop. But no, I wait. Then wait some more. There are other guests were waiting too and I don't want to cut in from of them. 

Finally a fifth guy walks out and says "what can I get you?". How warm. 

He sells me the expresso which was good but way over priced. 

One star because the only thing you have to do at an expresso bar is make the drinks quickly and be friendly. That's it. When you do neither, you're one star.

I was walking around early in the morning trying to find a decent cup of coffee. My friend recommended this place and I happened to wander around and run into this place. They have well lit glass cases filled with delectable treats. I was tempted to get something buttery but I decided that I just wanted coffee. I ordered a caramel machiato large and spent $7.57; which is outrageous! This was the most expensive cup of coffee I ever had. But the flavor was good and it wasn't overwhelmingly sweet. But I'm in Vegas and stuck so I paid the high price. It was good to try once but probably will try a different place next time. They have the cutest display of espresso cups lined up one of the posts. Check it out, very neat.
One of the best services, very friendly staff, great food at a great price, our company is very satisfied with their catering, thank you Vladimir for all what you did for us

I like the atmosphere, the selection of desserts and drinks.
Staff are always friendly too.

One knock... a couple of times the dining ware (plates, mugs or glasses) were not 100% clean.

UPDATE : just went again today, Torta al Cioccolato was under done, cashier was unpleasant - taking away one star.

I love this place, but some of them are a bit pricey. The gluten free muffins were a bit sweet. The blueberry cheese danish is good. Sometimes too much sugar in the cream cheese. The latte is excellent. It's what keeps me coming back for more. I like the sandwiches on ciabatta bread as well. Some of them good. Some of them soggy. I like the washrooms too. They are nice and clean. There used to be vegan truffles, but they don't don't carry them anymore. It's called Dolce. The people behind the counter are very friendly and service always comes with a smile.

Good cappuccini, but: 1. Charging $6 is excessive; 2. And more upsetting, charging a dine-in fee for the cup is ridiculous... You try to reduce trash and in effect get less coffee and are charged more? C'mon.

This cafe is inside Yorkdale Shopping Centre, located on the second level where you take the escalator up to the food court. 

Small but very cozy place. Excellent espresso and espresso drinks, illy is what they use as the name says it. Don't miss out their pastries, fresh, flaky, buttery......in a lot of varieties.

We all ordered gelato here last week and the stuff was excellent!  The only reason I did not rate this place a 5 is due to the astronomical pricing of the gelato.......come on ILLY......30 bucks for 4 single scoop gelatos:-(

The best dessert cafe in all of Toronto (thus far). Their desserts are obviously better than and much more superior to Starbucks,  second cup and aroma and many other desert cafes I've tried. 

My favorite is the Tiramisu..I drive to yorkdale just for this! *mouth waters* my husband comes here for the cannot I'm which I must admit are also very delicious. 

As for their coffee, comparable to second cup (I'm a huge second cup fan). Very good but nothing out of this world. Their service was fast and friendly. They lose a star for the coffee, they messed up my husband's dopio long espresso machiatto twice. If you're a reputable coffee place that does coffee right, a machiatto should be a no brained! 

Decor is lovely, great atmosphere, very clean store overall.

I'll definitely keep coming back for my Tiramisu!!!

At first I was excited that a gourmet coffee shop had opened up in Yorkdale where I do most of my sopping, but was disappointed once I tasted some of their goodies. The orange almond muffin I tried was stale and the goodies seemed like they were sitting there for at least over 24 hours. I'm a baker so I notice these things, instead of using orange juice or zest like you should in a gourmet baked good, they had used concentrated orange flavour which gave left a bitter chemical after taste in my mouth, and no real butter. 

However the coffee was god and it wasn't too busy. It was a great place to sit down and take a break while shopping.

I go back when I am in Vegas because the coffee is good but this last time over Thanksgiving, the customer service soured me on this place. We waited for someone to help us where we thought was the right "line", we waited and waited. Finally, the counter lady said the line was some where else, a few steps away. She saw us there waiting and let us wait and made us go to some other lady to order. Then after ordering, waiting some more for our coffee, we notice the other lady helping customers after she made us go somewhere else! Basically, service sucks. Please refresh on your customer service skills or get new employees so I can return and enjoy your coffee.

On my way walking back to the Palazzo at 11:30pm, I wanted gelato. First, we went to Cocolini which is located in the St. Mark's square but it was closed. We were instructed to go to IIIy. The price here definitely gone up! It is now  $5.50 one scope and $7.5 for two! Cone is $1.5 more. They also changed their serving cup which looks the same as Cocolini when I saw it in yelp just now.

I wanted the pina calada gelato but they didn't carry the favor. I had the passion fruit gelato but didn't like it... too sour... My friend had the watermelon but it tastes a bit watery... maybe because my passion fruit tasted stronger. I wanted gelato again the next day and went to Tintoretto which is located at the far entrance of canal shoppers and had much better gelato. Their gelato is also less pricey which is a little under $5 including tax and sugar cone!

Pros: It's in Vegas. The interior is open and bright. The cappucino was strong yet delightful. (1 star for location, 2 stars fo espresso).

Cons: The service was less than desirable. Even that was better than napoleon- stale, rubbery and lacking goo flavor. Avoid the pastries! (0 stars for bake goods). 

Want fabulous chocolates? Head to Vosges @ Caesars.

Delicious! 

I have had some good gelato, but this gelato was pretty sweet! I had blood orange flavor and it was smooth and silky almost. It tasted so go. I liked how they put a little wafer cookie in the gelato. Oh and it wasnt like $16 like it was in a different casino. It was about 5 bucks and all the more delicious! I would love to go back! 

The guy was very patient with me, trying all the flavors I did. I just could not decide because there were flavors I have never even heard of and I was like a kid in  a candy store! It was a good night to have ended it there! :)

Great espresso and pastries as well as amazing presentation. The only downside to this place is a lack of organization - 3 people helped me with a shot of espresso and a pastry. Customers and employees were extremely confused what to do where to order and pay - it can get frustrating.

I came by around 11:30pm and had never tried this coffee place before and figured I'd give it a shot. So just keep in mind that they close the kitchen around 11pm. If you want food show up earlier than that.

My experience is based only on my interaction with an employee named Jose and simply the coffee he made for me.

I asked what they were known for and he said the caramel macchiato, I agreed. I wanted food but I had shown up too late, that's okay no problems there. But simply the way he talks to customers and the coffee he makes... Makes this review a 5 star. By far the best drink I've had in long time. He didn't make me feel bad for coming in late, or asking plenty of questions. Exactly what I look for in customer service, being that I work in that field.

If management sees this, give this man a promotion or something! He deserves it by his display of exceptional customer service. Thank you Jose, I'll be back for sure.

Oh man, gelato, you are veryyy pricey here (~$6 for one scoop). I was tempted but convinced myself to get a berry crepe instead for ~$12. It was quite good. Strawberries, blueberries, blackberries, whipped cream on top of a chocolate/nutella and strawberry sauce filled crepe. The strawberry sauce was a little too much for me. A little too sweet. But everything else was good. Of course it's not as cheap as crepes back at home around $5-6 but it will have to do for Vegas. 

As for service, the man who served us was very friendly, took our plate out of the way when we were done eating, and reminded us we could stay and keep talking.

I love Illy cafe, is the beast italian coffee in the world. Every time I'm at the Palazo Venetian hotel I stop at this place, and drink the beast cappuccino.
Make me fill in Italy.

I like this place. The staff is decently cordial, and the gelato is amazing. Unfortunately, there are only a couple vegetarian options for lunch including a caprese and a mozzarella and tomato pizza, but otherwise, the atmosphere is nice. Plus, they have a great chai tea latte.

I have a lot of idiot moments. Like when I ordered the "tart with the pear on it" and the woman behind the counter said "Oh, the pear tart?" Yeah, that. 

Well, luckily the pear tart was amazing. I'd been craving some kind of pear tart for months. Not really sure why. I had a frozen coffee drink which was also fabulous and for a cappuccino, it wasn't too bitter and just the right amount of sweet.

We got a little turned around trying to find it (don't spend much time at palazzo) and when asking for it, most of the staff just refer to it as "the Italian coffee place". Probably safe to just ask for that. 

The atmosphere was nice and a little less Vegas-y than the usual coffee shops. Felt almost like I could be in a train station somewhere other than the middle of the desert.

The gelato was just ok. I expected much more but it was just ok. Service was very good. I asked for a cup of water and they gave me a free bottle so that was a plus. Even though I am giving 3 stars I will give this place another try next time I am in area.

Terrible customer service. I wanted gelato and they had many flavors so I wanted to try them. After two I was still undecided and was asking for third and the guy was 3 samples only are you sure you want to try this one? We had 3 people in our group and we all were going to purchase. It left a sour mood. I never been to an ice cream place that doesn't give samples. The gelato is mediocre and expensive. Never ever coming back

Terrible staff the morning we visited. Cashier did not pay attention to me as I ordered. Missed items, asked me if my items were to go or eat in, really didn't matter what my answer was as she did the opposite. The tall male manager on duty was also no help. Apologizing to me as he rung up my missed item. An overpriced joke.

The latte here is great.  And the pastry and cheesecake are delicious.  I had the pistachio cheesecake.  It is smooth and has the right amount of flavour.  But the real reason they can charge so high a price (7.95 for a tiny piece of cake) is the patio, overlooking the mall floor filled with shoppers below.  Instead of lining up for 15 min. inside the hot sweaty Starbucks, I will gladly pay up for a table here.

Starting your day with a White Mocha Latte, Caramel Ice Latte, or Half and Half (Chocolate & Coffee) is really the best way to go! MmMmMm, I love Illy Coffee!!  Along with eye opening delicious beverages, Bacon, Cheese, Egg Panini Croissant or Sausage, Cheese, Egg Panini Croissant is also very tasty!  Then finishing off with an Apple Cinnamon Caramel Crepe .... mMmMm, what a wonderful way to begin your day in Vegas (without alcohol...yet)!?  White Mocha Latte for the win!

Food: 
I ordered a bacon and egg croissant which was decent but not worth $10.

Service:
Decent service. Quick but not friendly. 

Atmosphere: 
Great seating area. It can accommodate a large group of friends. Cool place to have a morning coffee and converse with friends.

Espressamente illy initially captured my attention more than any other food offerings at Yorkdale for its unique location on a dedicated floor right below the food court. I finally decided to pay a visit with a friend for a cup of joe. The drinks are definitely on the pricier side but it is quite nice if you want a quiet spot to relax and enjoy a conversation. The staff are quite friendly and approachable. I would definitely recommend this spot for people who need an escape the crowds of the mall.
Half and half  = Hot coco + espresso... SO GOOD~~~ and I don't usually drink coffee....
Good strong espresso drinks inside the Venetian right next to the LOVE sculpture. Prices weren't crazy either. They have a large gelato selection as well.

It's an upscale ice cream stand- get over it.  Gelato was good, selection and service was good. Service for the time of eve and length of the line was also good. But hey, when your in a hotel like the Venetian it's expected isn't it?

Espressos good, gelato isn't. 

When you need a little pick me up, like a legal one - in Vegas, this is definitely a solid choice! Who wants disgusting hotel drip coffee? Not me - hopefully not you!

Here, at least you know they're using decent espresso beans.

The gelato - like most hotel gelato out here, is a total fail. I'd say try whatever flavor you have in mind because most that I thought would be guaranteed delish were not and I settled on birthday cake, which was just ok after trying three others. My boyfriend ordered butter pecan and did not like it. I think he said, not only is it not good - it's bad. Never a good thing!

Open until 1A which is a plus. We stopped in after a late night dinner.

During my recent Vegas trip, I was desperately in need of good coffee. My husband and I have looked everywhere and  tried coffee offered in many different shops and hotels (there was a Coffee Bean right at the entrance to our hotel rooms); however, our search for a good decent edible cup of coffee as a pick me up was met only with much disappointment.  

Finally, on our last day in Vegas, we stumbled upon Expressamente in the passage way between Palazzo and Venetian... We didn't have much expectation when we first found this place b/c of the disappointments in our prior days of search... But man when I had a sip of their latte, I had a sigh of relief ... We finally found a cup of coffee that is at least edible and enjoyable - with nice coffee bean taste instead of just pure sugar/cream taste or burnt coffee taste... Finally, a piece of heaven :)

My husband is much pickier of his coffee... he's a third-wave coffee hipster or what you may call a coffee connoisseur...tho the coffee here still didn't meet his standard... At least it filled my craving and need for a cup of edible and enjoyable coffee. So I'd say if you can't find anything (coffee wise) you like in LV, try this place ;)

In addition, I'd add that their crepe is pretty good too. We ordered the very berry and chocolate crepe. It was pleasing to the eyes. Taste was average to me.  I'll try to add a photo for you.
Their service sucks! All the workers were chit chatting. They didn't ask customers what they need- impolite interaction. 2 thumbs down

A nice little treat after eating at any of the restaurants nearby.  Its pricy, but the gelato is very good.

I have have not tried the beverages, and that may be where its at. I wouldn't make a special trip here.

i luv the coffee here....but it is pricey! it was ever so smooth and thinking about it makes me want more! hubby had a yummy caramel macchiato and i had an iced froth coffee and they were both good....way better than starbucks! if im here again i will go back!

We tried the cannoli today and both me and my friend didn't like it.  He said it was not good in texture and very heavy.  My sentiments were the same.  And the biscuit outer shell was stale.  I had asked the server if the cannoli was fresh and he said it was made same day.

The cafe was clean and had nice decor.  I would like to try their coffee one day.  I thought prices were on the high side.

When you need some caffeine versus retail therapy, this cafe is the perfect place!

I like how there is a bright private self-seating area to relax for a little bit.
All the desserts looked amazing!
And they do have soy and almond milk options available instead of milk (+$0.75).

The drinks are expensive here.
The cakes are too, but they are worth it and delicious!
I was impressed by the selection of sweets.

However, if I were here on a date, I might feel a bit awkward having to wait in a long line up cafeteria style.  And if there isn't a table available, you could be standing around waiting for a bit!

Anyways, I'm sure I will stop by here again. :D

Coffee here is great, as you should expect. However, the service falls flat on its face. The point of coffee at an espresso bar is hot and fresh. Things need to be served to you right off the machine. However, here your order fits in with all of the rest of the food orders and such, and your cup will most likely languish in the pass, waiting for someone to finish doing whatever they are doing and then they will call the numbers out. Coffee is not the accent here, it's less than a third of all the "stuff" they sell - the coffee should be split from the food service, which takes them much more time. In my case, the guy who should have been running the pass disappears into the back room, and the cashier happened to notice I was standing there and came down to call out the numbers of the stuff he left. Pathetic (she got the tip though). There are too many Starbucks spots around to worry about coming here for your espresso fix. If they treated espresso as it is done in Italy, this would be top notch, but it's a Vegas Blvd experience.

While exploring the new Palazzo, we found ourselves in front of this brightly lit up shee-shee fancy coffee shop/dessert place/whathaveyou. What caught our eye was the gelato and although they offered much more, I wasn't paying attention. 

Like the other Yelpers, it was pricey and when I saw the prices, I told my mom that I didn't want anything, but she insisted (gotta love moms!) since she wanted some gelato bad. I chose one scoop of the canteloupe gelato and my mom got one scoop of the lychee gelato. Both were very refreshing and full of yummy fruit flavor!

Not sure if it'll be a "must stop at spot" for future Vegas visits, but I would like to try their raved coffee in the future.

Overpriced and not a friendly place to spend any downtown in Las Vegas. A vanilla latte and double espresso ran us $14! I rather pay for the expensive coffee at coffee bean or Starbucks. Also, the vanilla latte they charged me extra for, was a normal latte. Will not return again.

I was so excited to go in here because of their huge selection of gelatos. However, I felt really unwelcomed the second I stepped into the shop. The guy behind the counter seemed annoyed every time I asked to sample their flavors. I'm sorry that I don't know 3/4 of the flavors are and don't wanna waste $6 for one scoop of gelato that I might regret. I ended up getting the guava and pineapple gelato. I wouldn't even call it gelato because it wasn't the slightest creamy and tasted more like stop and shop sorbet. I've definitely had better gelato for a way better price. There are many other places on the strip, so I suggest going to other gelato shops.

So many gelato flavors and so little time!

To cool off from the outside scorching dry heat, we decided on sweet gelatos in the Palazzo. Yes, Expressamente Lily offer more selection such as coffee drinks, crepes, breakfast sammies but we went straight for the kill on the gelatos.

I can't remember what my friend got in turns of favor but I know she like it a lot. I got my favorite flavor of Pistachios and love tonguing it like a lizzard or french kissing. IT was that GOOD!  The prices was fair for a couple of scoops.

We brave back outside and didn't mind the sun melting our gelato into our hands because we were too busy in our conversation and making out with our gelatos. 

Recommended for a sweet & cool treat.  This place will make you a fan, too!

Super yummy (as always) Illy coffee! 

If you are staying in The Venetian or here it's a convenient location and they also have fresh made desserts. The gelato looks sooo good and next time I go here I will def try a bite! 

My soy iced Mocha was a perfect blend. Not too sweet and not bitter. 

If you are familiar with Illy coffee then this location is perfect for you. 

As always...it's priced about a dollar higher due to it being located inside a casino.

A lot of people here were talking about the affogatos, so I decided to get one here with two scoops of stracciatella gelato. Everything tasted good, and the price for it wasn't too bad.

The employee however, was a little cold, therefore I'm taking one star away.

Incredible 54 flavors of artisan made gelato & sorbeto. Highly recommend their Blood Orange and Grapefruit combo for citrus lovers. Their flavors pack a punch of flavor, and those citrus flavors were oh so refreshing! They're open late - close at 1AM - so for those roaming near the strip with gelato cravings... this should be your go to spot! It is quite pricey though, ended up costing $20 for a two scoop cone and Affogato! Located inside Palazzo Hotel.

Good tasting crepe. My girlfriend and I got the mixed berry crepe as a morning treat and the jam & berry combo was delicious. Not overly too sweet. Great tasting Illy coffee. Not worth the $3.50 small sized "fresh squeezed" orange juice. There's plenty of gelato choices, but we didn't get to try any.

Review is for gelato only. 

$8 (after tip) for two scoops. Gelato was marginal: poor texture, ice crystals, and passable flavor. Would be fine for a $2 scoop, but for this price I should be getting something better than a grocery store freezer case, not something worse.

The food is ok nor more then that,and the coffee is good , but the SERVICE IS SO BAD that ill never repeat that mistake!
After you talk with the manager here you understand why all the employees don't give a SH.. About your requests.
 Bad name for illy brand.

I love the set up of this location. 2nd floor of Yorkdale's new food court.   The indoor patio area is very inviting.  The seating arrangement and display of all the sweets are tempting.  a very friendly serving staff.  Maybe it was because the manager and owner were casually glancing over its staff.  It's definitely a place to put your feet up and relax from a day of shopping.  I could only imagine how busy it was during this past holiday season.

Are you serious? $5.50 for ONE scoop of gelato? And then $7.50 for TWO scoops? Holy!!! This has GOT to be expensive. I guess they get a free pass since it is located inside the Palazzo but still! They have tons of flavors ranging from lychee to guava to passionfruit, to tiramisu, etcetc. 

Come here if you absolutely NEED a gelato fix but if you can wait it out, go elsewhere.

LOVE at first site. I was walking toward the blackjack tables inside the Palazzo when  the beautiful, vibrant colored gelato caught my attention. There were sooooo many different flavors. I was so excited because I have a huge obsession with anything creamy and frozen. 

The guy serving me was really nice and patient with my indecisiveness. But after sampling about 7 different flavors, I settled on mango. Mmmm so refreshing. A tad bit tangy and just enough sweetness. It was $5 something for the 1 scoop and was worth every penny. I walked away with the cup of gelato in my hands, smiling like a lunatic. At that point, nothing else mattered. Blackjack tables? whatevs.
Always great food and service when I go there. I love their lattes and treat myself to a dessert once in a while. Haven't had their sandwiches so I can't say. It's a bit pricey but it's worth it.

Viva espresso macchiato.  I read a few reviews.  EVERYONE!  This is a coffee place first and a very good one.  Sure they have other stuff, and I bet it is fine but there are a ton of places to get ice cream.  Get an espresso I liked the espresso macchiato.  The flavors are amazing.  If you like Coffee you will be happy.  Oh and hurry up We are waiting for more!

It's quite overpriced, even for gelato and vegas, 5.50 for one scoop? I'd suggest you make it a cone, they give you more. The flavors were okay, nothing too spectacular. The pistachio gelato wasn't very good. I've definitely had better.

Unfortunatelly i didn't get a coffee... wasn't feeling up to the caffine... but my coffee loving friend who likes Illy was happy to be there with a cup of chilled latte in hand... I had a crossiant sandwich was was not bad (but nothing fancy)... The gelato was good. The line was long.

I walked by once.  I walked by twice.  But on that fateful third pass, my feet turned in as if of their own volition to this location located between the Venetian and Palazzo hotels.

Rainbow colors of gelato greeted me.  My ice cream parched system, cried "Yes, Yes!"  And suddenly I found myself with 2 scoops of savory, coconut gelato in a small cup in my hand and the soft creamy coolness sliding down my throat.

Expensive?  Sure . . .everything at the Venetian is.  But for this one moment . . . . .ice cream in hand, that I took to savor on the deck of the pool, it was worth it.  Even if it meant more time on the treadmill in the morning!
delicious gelato, but pricey! They offer several sugar free options!

This is a perfect spot to enjoy an ice cream or a coffee while u wait for the gondola ride!
Ask for Omar he is the best making caffe latte!
We got the espresso and mint chocolate gelato, they both are tasty and sweet, service is fast and place is very cute, they have over 30 different selections.

Second time here and happy
I came back. Their double espresso is to die for. They sure know what they are doing here. And their gelato rocks too!

If you are lucky enough to stay in this hotel or be at a conference, this is the best spot to jump in and grab a coffee and quick grub.  Meaning personal pizza or wrap/sandwich to do.  They do have these incredible deserts and nibbles that are delicious.  The only reason they don't get 5 stars is due to their prices.  Ouch!

I've had their gelato as well, and their plus is they have every possible flavor imaginable. 

So take a break from gambling, but down your phone and have a sip and a bite!

This is a refreshing change from your small quick dining options while in Vegas. You're usually either stuck with the run of the mill 24 hour hotel lobby diner, a subpar casual dining experience, mall food or gift shop snacks. Also, if you don't want Starbucks, or maybe you can't stomach another vodka redbull amidst all the casino funk, wander over here and have an affogato or any of the other espresso treats. You can keep going, and the precious caffeine will subdue your eventual onset of a hangover just a few additional hours.

It's Vegas, everything is marked up, so get over it. 2 scoops of gelato will run you $8.08 (tons of flavors and very hard to pick just one), and lunch specials (paninis, salads, etc.) start around $15, I believe.

Pricey but good espresso and gelato.

Espressamente Illy is my go to place when I walk through Venetian and Palazzo and crave some caffeinated boost.

I have make a big downgrade. After trying it for the second time, I realized it just didn't taste as good as the first time. Maybe I was too drunk the first time to realize. haha

But yes, the gelato is just very sweet. TOO SWEET! And the price was absurb! One scoop was $4.50. That's just too expensive! And not worth the price.
So I am not big on coffee, but I got the two scoops of gelato with espresso poured over it.  Dangerously delicious.
Ice cream is so good...pretty close to really Italian one. But ... 8.50 dollars for two scoops...well...

Very rude staff, while I ordered the lady barked at me: "for here right!?!?" I said no to go. They never asked what kind of bagel I wanted, and when my order was up they called out the wrong number, when I asked about it I got more attitude. $14 for coffee and a breakfast sandwich and the worst staff I've experienced  on my trip. I don't think I've ever given a bad review on Yelp but this place deserves it.

Gelato reviews? No no no no no! ILLY MAKES COFFEE people! Take a look around, *this* is coffee heaven. They may also sell gelato, sandwiches, crepes, etc, but they are a coffee company. A damn good one. Savor the coffee, people.

I was just lured inside. It's so authentically Italian - the stainless, the shiny glass, the real panini, the gorgeous coffee equipment. It was like Italy. Why aren't these stores everywhere?! Please build one in Boston, please. I loved it here. If it were near my hotel I would have been there every day, twice a day. 

Illy coffee is sublime in it's subtle, strong, earthy, ie, Italian way. We ordered two coffee drinks, an affogato and a half and half something or other. Ok, one has gelato. I admit it. But, when is the last time you saw affogato on a cafe menu? I HAD to order it. It's a favorite and I'm in Vegas - it's all about excess for just four days. The other drink was great too. SO great, it was hard to drink them slowly, and savor them the way you are supposed to in a European cafe. Then again, Barney's is just around the corner, and that was calling.

I ordered their cafe late and it was delicious! I like that they have so many different authentic coffee drinks. Wish I was in the mood for gelato, because a lot of people seemed like they were really enjoying it. Great location. Very close to the Venetian, where I stayed. 

I like the decor, it has authentic feel to it. I definitely had to add some sugar to the late though, but I suppose a lot of people actually like the taste of the coffee. It's definitely pricey for a coffee place. It was about $14 total for 2 lates and 1 hot chocolate. 

Service was fast and they accommodated a ton of people eagerly waiting for Illy!

This place really disappoints me now...they no longer have this great manager that seemed to keep the place going. The last few times I've been there my order was wrong, the staff isn't very friendly and then the man behind the counter just walked away after helping the people in front of me saying oh she will help you...waited another few minutes and finally someone acknowledged me. I almost felt I was give crappy service because I am Caucasian???? I really hope that is not the case! 
Suggestion: Get a good manager!!!
Good Gelato... felt authentic.  The Affagato was only OK.  My wife enjoyed here crepe.  Prices were a bit high, but that's gelato for you.

Favorite coffee brand has it's own shop?  Sign me up!  After reading the descriptions of the beautifully crafted espresso drinks on the light board, I decided on the 'Half and Half'.  

Delicious!  It was like 2 drinks in one.  Bottom chocolatey half, then lift the straw a bit and get a rich espresso flavor.  Wife didn't care for it but I loved the contrast.    If I ever get lost or turned around in this area again, I'll definitely be coming back for my caffeine fix.

3.5 stars, rounding up b/c the affogato was simply luscious. Tried the stracciatella and hazelnut, both were excellent with illy espresso poured over.

As Janet P. noted (5/18), Espressamente offers an impressive selection of gelatos - two full counters worth.

Espressamente Illy is located in the mall area of The Palazzo Hotel. As you would expect the store is really nice looking. Nice decor. There aren't many seats though. I had a hazelnut gelato and my BF had one that tasted like eggnog. Both were pretty good. The hazelnut one was really good. The prices may be high but I am willing to pay extra for a good hazelnut gelato. It is so hard to find even a decent one. Be warned - the portions are very small here. Minus one star for not having a chocolate hazelnut/Nutella/Ferrero gelato. If you talk the talk you should walk the walk. This place charges enough so it should have all the best flavors. Minus another star for bad service. Usually, if you walk into a place, you get back what you give. My BF and I rarely get bad service but the drone behind the counter here was not taught to smile and/or be welcoming when he meets people when he was a child I guess haha! Plus, he motioned us over to the register with a rude hand gesture and some sort of grunt.

Friendly, great service and the drinks are awesome.

The service is very friendly and the boss is the friendliest. They serve you with a smile and are thorough with the order.

You can't go wrong with any of the food or drinks there, so experimenting is less frightening.

Although everything is great it's also very pricey. A fruit bowl(more of a cup) is $5 which is really steep for a few cuts of fresh fruits. Other than that it's a very professional establishment.

Expensive Gelato, but HUGE selection & very creamy & delicious. Excellent cappuccino's . Quick service. Excellent location . In-between the Palazzo & Venetian by the waterfall.HeathBar Crunch!!!! WOW!

Me and my wife were staying at palazzo and wanted to get a coffee after lunch.  Went there and it wasn't very busy but the staff was not very friendly. Service was fast but we ordered a frappe and it was very bitter and not what we were expecting. The gelato looked good though.

stupid as I was - plan to try restaurants IN THE MORNING! IN LAS VEGAS!

of course none of my target restaurants is open and I was starving when I saw this spot.

Love the way they decorate this lovely place. The food are surprisingly good - maybe cos I was too hungry?

Didn't try the Gelato. 

Nice spot to enjoy a lovely breakfast before catch a flight.

I finally stopped in for a coffee today, after walking by a million times gazing...and drooling. It was a bit early for gelato or any candied apples, but I definitely like the selection they had. Service at the counter was friendly and fast.

Next time, I'll make sure I have time to lounge and drink my coffee, which many customers were doing that day. If you're down there by the Palazzo or Venetian, and you're looking for a change-up from the everyday coffee shops, and want to drool at some desserts (better yet, just eat one), then I'd recommend Espressament Illy :)

I'm fairly one to rate a place like this low, and when I began this review I sincerely wanted to toss them a 2 star based on price alone, but after some consideration I upped the extra star and here is why.

This place gets full marks on being unique, sheik, and trendy. The also produce a quality cup of premium coffee that I would say is second to none. However, as I mentioned before the major deterrent for me here is price. You wanna talk pretentious prices? This place makes Starbucks look like a Coffee time! Two coffees and a small piece of cake came out to $20! 

I don't care how perfect my Americano was, how crisp and clean finishing it was and how it didn't need a pinch of sugar or milk in it. AND I don't care how unbelievable the chocolate cake sliver (not slice... sliver) was, $20 for 3 items without getting properly fed is redic!

I will say that if you're looking for a key date spot fella's this is a great one. It's classy, sophisticated and polished. Staff are nice and the location is great! But still, my god the price!!!

And just to try and sweeten the deal, the staff handed us a full box of canoli's as we were leaving stating that they would just go to waste any way... stop trying to buy my vote ha ha

It was amazing expresso!!!  This place is located on the ground floor of the Canal Shoppes near the Palazzo.  The owner is super friendly and was so kind to customize my expresso the way I liked it, even though it isn't the "traditional way".  I read great reviews about it and it did not disappoint.  If you love coffee and are in Vegas, definitely stop by!

A little ritual I have is to stop by here for a coffee whenever I am at Yorkdale. No real complaints, but the price is a tad bit high for the quality of coffee and pastries served. Given the location, I guess this is to be expected.

I'm supposed to be cutting back on coffee this year, but:
#1: I'm not trying very hard
#2: it's no help when the bf asks if I want coffee every single time we pass by a coffee shop

We were strolling through the Palazzo in the early morning. He was in search of food and I had no idea why I got dragged along. He asked me if I wanted coffee, but I didn't go into the shop the first time around. I couldn't resist and came back later in the afternoon while he was STILL in his poker tournament (seriously, those things last FOREVER. I came back 5 hours later after eating at the Stratosphere and he STILL hadn't lost... UGH! But I digress.)

I wandered back to the shop while waiting for the bf to lose. The cappuccino gelato was pretty good, but the guava gelato was a little too sweet. It was something like $8.11 for both scoops. I'd probably come back to try the espresso and mocha gelato flavors the next time I'm at the Venetian :) Hopefully he asks again if I want coffee, and I'll be sure to say YES.
The ice-cream was ok! I got a caramel macaron and it was sooo bad!! I think it was in their fridge for years :(

I spent a lot of time at Espressamente Illy while at a conference for my company.  It is a great place to relax, catch your breath and escape the masses with a nice cup of coffee, crepes or a refreshing gelato!  I personally have always loved the Illy brand coffee and was thrilled to see this nice cafe here.  The espresso is rich and dark with a perfect layer of crema on top...yum.  The staff is pleasant and attentive.  Thank you Espressamente Illy for the wonderful reprieve during a busy week.

I usually go to Espressamente illy to get my capsule for my illy machine. As they have more variety at a reasonable price compare to Amazon.  I did try their cake here once or twice, the thing I remember is it is pricey but they were pretty good. You get what you pay for.  It is pretty much in line of other good Patisserie shops like Amadeus (which is my fave place to hit up haha) So I guess it is okay to treat yourself to some expensive cake once in a while.  I like this place because it remains me of Europe especially Italy where illy cafe is in most corners and not the junk we have here aka Nespresso.  illy is far superior and worth every penny more, I can't understand how people can drink Nespresso at all.  I will be back soon as I am running out of coffee capsules and might be tempted to try another of their cakes.
They have really good ice cream and coffee and crepes but there service is slow they act like they don't see you other then that nice quick place to get a quick snack or ice cream.

I think all the gelato served at Venetian and Palazzo are Cocolina because we went to four different places and they all served cocolina.  I got the lemon ice gelato here which started off really refreshing and ended up extremely sour but still good...  just couldn't finish it.  The gelato is really pricey but the same price at all the places.  They also serve crepes here and other desserts.... and obviously specialize in Illy coffees.

Loved the gelato

Seemed a bit overpriced but... it is Vegas and what isn't overpriced here.

I don't understand why so many people are saying this place is expensive, think about it we're in Vegas not only that you're at the Palazzo. The Palazzo is far from cheap so keep that in mind when you want to buy some gelato or anything else here. I came pretty late around 12 and they were still open so that's a plus. The employees probably could have been a little more friendly but at least they weren't rude. 

So I wanted some fruit and I had just came from Walgreens on the corner and they had some fruit cups that were about the same price as Illy. So I'm a sucker for gelato so I got that instead (grapefruit) and it was so refreshing. Illy also had some sandwiches and some other little snacks. I would probably come here again because it's open late and my gelato was very good.

I think this place is really sub par for the pricing.  If all you crave is a shot of espresso, then great, good stop.

They have a million and one gelato options including many sugar free and fruit options, but none of it is that good.  On a gelato scale it is maybe a 5/10.  

The crepes are not that great except for the nutella, and um how can nutella be bad on anything?  The crepes are cold, berries aren't fresh, etc.

Two single scoop cones that don't taste that great= even in vegas = RIP OFF
Worst espresso ever!   Too hot, and flat taste.  Trap-type drink is sweet with no coffee flavor, like a milky sweet icee.    Starbucks tastes better than here.  Avoid at all costs!

The perezident and i stopped by here because we were starving and hungover. Cool cafe that has fancy gelato and tiny little cups for your espresso. I think  We had the $13 ciabatta sandwich and 2 bottled waters , which was ok. Sitting is limited, so cut in line if you have to. other then that nothing really special going on over here, i guess will give it another try on our next visit.
-ciao bella -ciao pasta!

After stuffing myself at Delmonico's at Venetian, we decided to walk it off at Palazzo. I have heard my friends rave about Illy's coffee, so while my party was lining up for gelatos, I asked about their coffees. 
"What kind of coffee do you have? Ground or beans?"
"Errr.... hold on."
This guy went to another for help.
"What was your question?"
"Do  you sell those coffee on display behind you? Are they instant or are they whole beans?"
"Well, it depends on what kind of coffee maker you have."
"So they are whole coffee beans for brewing?"
"..........."
"Or are they instant?"
"It depends on what coffee maker you have."
I decided to change my question since I am not getting any answer.
"What flavors do you have? "
"We have regular. What do you want?"
I gave up after that. I want French roast, Italian roast, Sumatra, Ethiopia, Peabody, Kona, Blue Mountain, But why bother asking me when all you have is regular???? Do I have other choices? And why do I need a coffee maker if I am using instant granules? That is , if they even carry it. It was so frustrating. It's like asking this guy if I look good in my new dress, I canNOT get a straight answer out of him.
The gelatos were ok, For the same price, I'd rather go to the stand in Venetian or Jean Phillippe Patisserie at Bellagio.

I have a beautiful time at this coffee bar, the services, coffee, gelato and the atmosphere is amazing. 
See you next time at palazzo.

illy coffee has got to be, one of the best coffee out there. This location is conveniently located between the Palazzo and the Venetian   and open quite late.  I stayed at the Venetian and after having dinner at Tao, this illy was a fantastic place to end our evening.

They have a good amount of seating area so you can catch up with friends and family, or simply chill and savor and sip a cup of their excellent espresso. Best of all, they even sell Gelato ice cream and scrumptious desserts.

Cheers!

When you see a cafe inside a high-end hotel and casino (Palazzo), you think, snobby customer service, and little portions.  not Espressamente illy.

The employees are always friendly when i walk in there and the service is super fast.  and thats why i always put some money in their tip jar or should I say tip vase.  I usually get the caesar salad because its the best i've tasted, not too much dressing, just enough croutons, and enough chicken breast to last me til the last bite.  i just wish it was a bit cheaper.  other than that the other items for lunch are good too. Like their pizzas, wraps, and sandwiches.

they also have an extensive selection of gelato, which i will try one of these days.

My girlfriend and I came here today to grab a cup of coffee because we are staying at the palazzo. For being in such a nice hotel I am appalled at how terrible the customer service was and how horrible the coffee is. Illy is supposed to be the best Italian coffee but the barista had not the slightest clue what he was doing. I work in specialty coffee and know what a good shot of espresso is supposed to look like. Let me tell you it's not what I saw here. The shot was pulled in about 8 seconds and tasted like water: I paid 6$ for a small latte that was terrible and the cashier was completely rude. 

I suggest going to coffee bean around the corner. and palazzo should really re consider having this establishment in their hotel as it does not reflect the quality the palazzo is know for.
Good coffee, but it wasn't friendly. The place is poorly laid out, chaotic, understaffed, slow, dirty, with very limited seating.

When I saw this place while walking between Palazzo and Venetian, it looked good. So I decided to try it on the day we leave on Sat 5/25. I bought two denishes and a slice of carrot cake. They were aweful. Basically they were not made the day. I don't know how long they have been on display, but the denises are hard and the carrot cake has a taste of fat which has been few days after they were made. I don't this this place belongs to Palazzo.

This place is like a mad house on the weekend. There was a steady flow of customers and one had to fight for a spot to get seat. 
I used to buy Illy espresso before I upgraded to a proper espresso machine and a grinder. For a standardized product their espresso was decent though pricey but in remote locations it was next best thing to buying fresh roasted products. 
First off the prices for desserts are ridiculous for a cafe. All this would have been OK had the desserts been decent, nope not here. I didn't try a cappuccino though might come back for one later. I went for an affigato and my friend ordered coconut cake of sorts. 
Affigato was OK but the cake was just horrendous. Think some of the worse cake one can buy in a grocery store. No real fat just gelatinous ugliness, devoid of taste and texture. My friend's espresso drink didn't prompt a response so not sure it was anything to special.
2 stars.
Good location. Great espresso and lemonades. Haven't tried the pasties here yet, but they look great too! This is a go to for my boyfriend and I when we need caffeine and are at Yorkdale mall.

I was excited to try this place because my sister raved so much about it. But if I could give them 0 stars I would. Service was absolutely horrible and the workers were extremely RUDE! One worker did the charging and the other one kept trying to get us to pay extra for things without telling us. They obviously do not communicate with one another so why were they trying to play tag team? Either teach your employees how to communicate and have better attitudes or have each employee take care of their own customers to make sure things are done right. After screwing up our orders by trying to overcharge us ends up not putting our crepes to go when we specifically asked them to. All employees need to fix their attitude and find out what customer service is about. Although coffee was good, I will NOT be coming back nor recommending this place to anyone until they fix this. Cannot believe how rude they are. Smh

Coffee was really rich and flavorful, although it comes in european size cups but hey its good it worth it.  Price is high for cup of good coffee but they have to pay the rent to the Palazzo. I recommend the Latte Vienne, a little sweet but so good.  We also order the salmon lox bagel which was fresh and yummy.

They make quality specialty coffee and coffee related products. Nice seating area around cafe. As well as lovely treats to pair w the drinks. It is more expensive than most coffee shops but it is a nice spot to grab a nice coffee while shopping at yorkdale or for a quick, delicious, healthy snack during a shopping break.

So when my number was called one item was missing, a bagel. My lady friend asks "what about the bagel, is it coming up?" Rude lil man behind counter loudly says "There is no bagel on your order!" #2 rude guy says "just give it to her," with some dumb smirk... Lady friend looks at receipt that's at our table and sees there is a bagel on the receipt. My lady friend with receipt in hand walks back to counter to advise the lil rude men that we are owed a bagel. She is ignored for minutes as this guy looks down not attending to my friend and calling out several order numbers. I basically had to yell at lil rude man and #2 rude man and ask them "IS THE BAGEL READY FOR THIS ORDER YET????!!!!!" And what do you know The bagel was done a minute later. 
These guys don't deserve jobs, they should be dropped in the middle of Death Valley with jacket, a straw and empty cup so they won't bother anyone else.

Geez, this place is expensive. $9 for two scoops of gelato. To be honest, you'll probably be better off with a pint of Talenti from the grocery store. 

The one pro is the variety of flavors. Good luck if you're indecisive. Pistachio was my favorite. 

Customer service was seriously lacking. No verbal interaction or smile besides "$9.03." My friend didn't realize it was her turn to be helped until we noticed the employee cup-stacking with one hand for the longest time. Perhaps a "may I help you?" or even "hi" could have worked? Felt bad for the customer behind us because she was trying to make small talk but the employees weren't having it. 

Overall experience was pretty uncomfortable, weird, over-priced and average. No thanks.

It's got the perfect location between the Venetian and the Palazzo by the waterfall. It serves the best coffees and expressos and offers free Wifi if you need to sit and take a break from gambling or shopping. 
There offer a wide selection of pastries, gelato, and sandwiches too.

Really cute place!  Its a bit overpriced, but its nice to treat yourself to  scoop of gelato after losing some money at the Palazzo.. or win..whatever.  

The worker recommended the mango or grape fruit gelato.  Its expensive, but the single scoop goes a long way.  The chocolate croissant was yummy too!

This cute little cafe looks very appealing, but is really meh. I've gotten the tea here, not the coffee, although if they do coffee right, Illy coffee is really good. The tea is fine. What is most disappointing is the desserts. They have always been mediocre at best, and I've always felt like I wasted money here. If you have good taste, you will likely be disappointed.

Wide variety, I had no idea where to begin. I wanted to sample almost every one of them and not get something that was of traditional flavors. They have so many flavors, with names that I have already forgotten. I sampled one and because I wanted to get out of there, I just got it. It reminded me a lot like cookies n cream. 

I know I love gelato but I guess at 7 bucks for single scoop, I'm just not that down with it. I like the wafer they top it off with, though. 

Honestly, I most likely will not waste my money here. There are other great places to get your gelato fix, ones that are topped on delish warm crepes for just a couple dollars more.

I love Illy coffee but I didn't care for the service or the outrageous prices at this joint. $4 for espresso and only filled up 1/4 of the cup... Basically a tablespoon of coffee. 
I've been here a few times now and seems it's worse each time. 
The gelato is also not anything special so I wouldn't recommend that either.

This place has every other gelato on the strip beat with it's selection and I dare anyone to try find a better place. I  had spent 4 days in Vegas doing nothing but eating, drinking and people watching and I had passed by the espresso place with the massive line many many times thinking, "I'll come back to you." I finally did during my last day and decided on the crepes and espresso side of the counter instead of the gelato line. 

The 20+ flavors did a great job impressing me and obviously the 15 people in line in front of me so with a heavy heart, I decided on a strawberry/chocolate crepe and an aranciata. I'm not a huge crepe person because they tend to be slathered in chocolate and drowning in sugar which these were not thank goodness. They were crispy on the edges, warm and each bite had an even strawberry/chocolate/crepe ratio which made for a great dessert. I'd never had Illy desserts before but after today, they proved their handiwork with crepes are as good as their espressos.

After a very late Vegas night, this was the perfect spot to stop in for a drink the next morning. I am not even a coffee drinker but I love illy's taste and quality. I ordered a caffe latte and it was perfect. We also had the apple crepe and it was tasty but I am really dreaming about the coffee. The setup was bright and clean and the service was great. Makes me want to stay at the Palazzo again the next time I come just so I can walk down for a drink.

SHUT UP !!!! If you know great coffee, pastries, and the like this is the place for you. If you don't then stop griping about price, and lines and all the other BS. Shut Up , eat drink, and pay the price for quality. There now go and enjoy perfection on these items !!!!! Everything is of the highest quality served in a European way...either you get it or you dont. starbucks which should not exist anywhere withing 1500 miles of a place like this is down the street...go there for cheap and crappy. The others ( like us) thank you for the shorter line !!!!

What an amazing coffee bar!!!

 I don't think I've ever seen one so exquisite and traditional outside of Italy. Illy is great coffee to begin with but I love the sleek, modern look of it's interior and how they use a variety of traditional cups to serve their coffee in depending on what you order. 

Just like cocktails, coffee is supposed to come in the glass/cup/ mug that it's pertains to.

I will for sure come back every time I'm in Vegas. I absolutely loved it. 

Get the cappuccino Viennese, so tasty and creamy!

Really good coffee but also very pricey 

We went at night and there was no line but I assume that it is probably busy in the morning.  They also have gelato!
Illy coffee is by far the most incredible coffee to get your morning started. Especially after a late night out in Vegas. Highly recommend the frappe latte. Delicious!!

There's nothing quite satisfying like a good gelato ice cream, especially if it's summer and 115 degrees outside. I recently came to Vegas during the July 4th weekend and our first order of business upon arrival was to drive to Palazzo for Illy ice cream at Espressamente. 

For Friday mid afternoon, the place was already packed and we waited 10 minutes in line. It's located inside the 1st level of Palazzo's shops, near the casino entrance. Specializing in European style coffee, pastries, made to order dessert crepes and Panini sandwiches, their delicious and beautiful window display of artisan crafted gelato is what attracted me to this charming eatery. 

With so many unique and luscious flavors to choose from (50+ flavors), it was difficult to decide. There friendly and helpful staff allowed us to sample some of their favorite and popular gelatos. We ended up getting a double scoop on chocolate waffle cone of pistachio, tiramisu and mango gelato. The gelatos were amazingly delicious and silky smooth. Although they were a bit pricey ($8 double scoop with chocolate waffle cone), it was definitely worth it. 

Recommend to anyone with a sweet tooth and love desserts. Remember you're in Vegas so splurge a little. I can't wait to come back!

Ok coffee due to the Illy beans and machines. Poor service. I asked for some seltzer water with my espresso, with an attitude. They didn't understand and gave regular water. For $4 espresso (single shot), hey should at least know how to serve espresso.

Their chai lattes are the bomb dot com but expensive. I mean, it's expected coming from Las Vegas and inside a luxurious hotel with a mall attached to it but shit, $7 a cup can buy me a box combo from raising cane's. The service was okay, it took them like 5 mins for them to acknowledge me while the line was growing behind me. 

Well whatever, it kept me warm while walking the strip and it was so good I came back a second time so it must be worth it somehow.

Espresso is just average, not sure if it's their maching or whether the beans were old but it had a burnt flavor that I didn't care for and I went on 3 different occasions.  Because it's right next to the main floor, it gets very crowded and feels more like a cattle car at times.  Still on the lookout for a great place to get my espresso fix in the morning at The Venetian.
Pretty decent cup of coffee or Latte or Espresso to be had.  Not the best I've had but decent enough to beat the alternatives.

Not much to say about this place based on my one experience so I'll try to not be wordy.

-2 scoops of gelato ($7.50... $8.08 with tax)
-Flavor: stratiatella=so good, tiramisu=aite
-gelato is kinda melty... don't blame the heat, it was November and we were indoors.
-right near our elevators at the palazzo so we were able to run back up to enjoy our ice cream in our comfy beds, like it ought to be.

My 2 cents: I expect utter gelato perfection if I'm spending $8 and my gelato was all melty once I was done paying. Hrm... I'll probably be back if 1) I'm at the palazzo, or 2) craving gelato in that vicinity.

I enjoy Espressemente Illy thoroughly.....  IMHO it doesnt get better than this... I have had their espresso (on multiple occassions), normal roast coffee, pizza, panini's and gelato....   I have been impressed by the quality of their food and coffee.  My wife LOVES their Vanilla Latte's too.  if you are near The Palazzo, hit it up....

What horrible service. I asked if they had dairy free ice cream and they said only the fruit flavored ones were. The vegan ice cream was apparently not dairy free so either they were false labeling the ice cream as vegan or the waitress did not understand what she was serving. I asked for a glass of water and she was resistant to give me one. Finally she told me the water was just tap water. I told her that was okay I still just wanted a glass of water. I was than told the water is not going to be any good. I said can I please just have the water. The gelato my girl friend had was icy not the usually creamy consistency of a good gelato shop. Over priced for the quality selection and service.

Love illy coffee. This caf located between Palazzo & Venetian. Perfect location for shoppers who walked all day. You just want to sit down and have cappuccino. Excellent quality of illy coffee and other sweet stuffs. Beautiful interior. Friendly service.

If you want good coffee, then this is probably one of the best places for one on the Strip. They really know how to make a latte here, especially when you compare them to generic coffee shops like Starbucks. Their affogato (gelato + espresso) was also great, and although I have never heard of such a thing prior to my visit, I was glad i tried it. The gelato also tastes rich in flavor and creamy, but definitely not as good as Cafe Gelato at the Bellagio. The prices may be high, but it should be expected in an upscale Vegas hotel.

Way overpriced gelato, but it is so delicious! Make sure you try a couple before you choose one, but I fell head over heels with the Hazelnut! The taste was on point and I would certainly go back despite the one scoop for approximately $7.  I also got a chai tea latte that was overpriced and again simply delightful and certainly would be something that I would order again because it was made so well.  The prices are way more than I would normally spend, but the quality is A+.  The service was alright.
1-5 Scale - (5 being A+)
Quantity - 4
Quality - 5
Price - 3

Girl shopping day with my buddy this afternoon. We passed by this cafe while taking the escalator to Yorkdale eatery court. A poster got our attention. 
Pls refer to my picture. :) 3 to 6 pm afternoon happy hour special $5.5 only includes a nice cappuccino or cafe latte with a signature pastries.  What a great deal to enjoy a nice environment !

Front staffs are helpful and cheerful. The staff is able to suggest what I wanted and my buddy asked for. We enjoyed the Italian cafe stop during shopping dun at Yorkdale Mall. 

We tried two different type of pastries : regular vs chocolate. Love it creamy and light . Chocolate is too sweet for us. Must try their coffee, with foam or not that's your choice.  The staff is attentive to our orders, accurately taken and made sure we got what we told and asked.  

Nice and enjoyable and affordable stop during happy hours in a busy stressed shopping from the crowd.  The magazine on the table make you feeling like living or having coffee in italy.  What a nice refreshment stop. The place is clean. However one star lost... because we got a dirty knife and we had to go back to the counter and got it replaced a new one for cutting pastries.  It is a shame the cutlery didn't get check before handing to the customers.... 

Overall, it is a comfortable coffee break in a busy shopping mall.
