I went here twice in the same day.  First time I got an iced vanilla latte which was strong and very good. Plus I liked the cup it came in. For four bucks I think it was worth it.  The second time I got pistachio gelato. It was ok. Didn't really taste like pistachio. I would probably just stick to coffee if I ever come back here again.

Illy coffee is infamous and Espressamente serves it. The flavor of their coffee was really rich and tasted delightful. I definitely felt the caffeine kick in after a few minutes, as the drink was kind of strong, which isn't a bad thing at all!

I ordered a strawberry banana crepe and a caramel macchiato for over $20. I received the wrong order of crepes. When I took it back, they said they were out of banana. Why they didn't tell me when I ordered, I don't know. I would've ordered something else. My drink tasted more like a watered down latte that was 1/2 foam for $8. Very disappointed.

Seriously, is this gelato made of gold? Because I can't remember the last time I paid $5.50 for a scoop of gelato. And it is good, but it ain't THAT good. 

Well....OKAY...I confess. Actually, it must be that good, because I have gone there EVERY DAY during meeting breaks for the last 3 days. So I take that last comment back. It's awesome. Mint chocolate chip in a cone. 

They have a TON of flavors, serving up Cocolini gelato like the Venetian but in the Illy environment with yummy coffee. Way more selection than the other locations though minimal on the seating.

So yeah. $5.50 a scoop. It's only $7.50 for 2 scoops. How bad is it that I succumbed a few days and got the biggie version along with a cone? Ahhh blessed 30 minute afternoon meeting break, feeding my gelato habit.

Espresso is fab too. Try the 'Espresso Shakerado'...it sounds odd, but it tastes oh, so good. The gym?? Yeah, I'll be reviewing that next.

Espresso was good. My moms drink didn't turn out that great tho and wanted them to remake it and the guy gave me some attitude and said something in Spanish that I take as being pretty rude. Uh ok won't come back.

In the words of Seth Meyers and Amy Poehler from Weekend Update, $6.75 for a small vanilla latte....really?  Really? 


(and please don't say "This is Vegas" or "You must have never been to Italy."  I know it is Vegas and I've been to Italy and throughout Europe, but to pay that much for water, a coffee bean, and flavored syrup just seems wrong when you can get it better elsewhere, cheaper)

This place is as AWFUL as ever. I have got to stop coming here! The people who work here are the lowest, most classless people on the planet. They are clearly prejudiced against anyone who isn't Hispanic like them. It was very evident when they went out of their way to take the order of the person in back of me even though I was next in line. I'm so sick of the reverse discrimination that has been going on here for years. Spare yourself the bad energy and hygiene that resides here and look for coffee elsewhere. Suggestion to management: Fire your lame staff and get some decent employees.

Excellent espresso, quick service, and an excellent assortment of gelato (although I did not take a taste).  The line gets ridiculous after eight a.m. but around 6 I was able to get in line and be waited on within a few minutes.  You can have your drinks for there or to go.  I ordered a double esprsso and it was piping hot with lots of crema.  It was perfect.  Anxiously awaiting the chance to go back and sample some gelato.
Great display and good service. Staff is friendly and patient when ur trying to decide. Ice cream was good as well.

I've always wanted to try something from this place. My friend and I were craving something sweet after our dinner and came across this place. To be honest, I wish we didn't come here.

The staff were not welcoming at all. No smiles, no hellos. They didn't look too happy giving us samples of some flavors either. I ordered 2 scoops of gelato, which was $9. Jesus. Let me just rewind to what happened before I received my gelato. The associate that was supposed to take my order stood there shuffling some gelato cups on the counter, while waiting for me to order. No eye contact with me was made, so it would've been nice to let me know that you were supposed to take my order. He took the order of the lady behind me as well. Poor nice woman tried to make small talk joking about the price and how in Italy, gelato is so cheap. No laugh, smile, or acknowledgement from the associate whatsoever.
$5.50 for a bagel- that too stale! The smallest sized cappuccino with no size options- what a waste and bad name for illy.

The MOST original place in Vegas in my mind. Here's a list of everything I love about Espressamente:
Illy coffee - as good as it gets!
Fresh gelato in a zillion flavors - highly recommend the Mango gelato
The BEST chocolate croissant outside of France (and maybe a certain boulangerie in Seattle)..warmed to perfection!
The warm caprese panini, with a side of orange twist, olive and a cup of chips
The impressive array of espresso cups that merit looking at as you ponder over breakfast, lunch or dessert options at this delightful little pastisserie in the Palazzo
Coffee is good (Bouchon's is better) but the crepes are horrible - cold and not very fresh. Save your calories and go to Bouchon!

it's a bit overpriced. 
overpriced gelato ($6 for a single scoop). coffees ($6 for a cup of joe's).  drinks.

my friend got the hazelnut and i got the pistachio
the hazelnut was creamy and delicious, but the pistachio on the other hand wasn't AS good. :-(

Every time when we are in town we like to try something new. This time our kids made a choice for us.It is very family friendly place, with a great choice of ice cream! The ice cream was soooooo delicious and there was such a big choice of it, I was kind of lost which one I should get so!!!
We actually came here a few times during our stay because we wanted to try breakfast and lunch menu. And we were kind of on a rush each time. And you now how it is, you come with little kids you order and you try to get out as fast as possible because kids get bored really fast.
I want to mention and highlight that the service was excellent and very fast. The employees were very nice and helpful, they saw that we were with kids and tried to do everything that they could to serve the food right away. The food, I ordered crepes were delicious and both of my kids end up helping me finish my food even though they asked for omelets)))
This place serves omelets, salads, sandwiches, wraps, ice cream, some cakes)))mmm and great coffee) Which was so tasty that I was coming back to get some more)
Definitely we will back to Espressamente next time when we are in town!
This is is Illy so coffee is great. The Moarocchino is really good. However, the sandwiches are overpriced. Still need to try the coffee floats.
The only reason why I'm giving this 5 stars is because of the chocolate shake! Get it! Delicious!

I don't this place is that confusing.  The way they fill orders (pay and then give your receipt to the person making your order) actually makes sense and is very authentically Italian (all Italian gelaterie do it this way).  

In any case, I didn't actually try the gelato but I did have the Illy coffee and that is enough for a four star rating.  It is good and strong and tasty.  I will continue to return here simply for the Illy caffe and, if I want something sweet, I would also definitely try the gelato.

Lots & lots of choices! So many to choose from! I love their huge selection of Ice Cream. I got the mango & lemon sorbet and loved every scoop.  Came with a little wafer which is very nice.  Of course it was over priced but what do you expect for Vegas?  It was also so conveniently in our hotel (Palazzo).  Wish I had known sooner that they also had crepes!
The gelato tasted it old and the hispanic lady helping me had a sour face the whole time not very friendly

I'm a VERY picky coffee drinker....I dislike Starbucks coffee now and it's just too bad that they have so many Starbucks on the stripe just like they do on every corner of San Francisco.  Which sucks!!  They should replace those Starbucks with Peet's.

Anyhow on with my review with Illy...I absoutly LOVE Illy coffee.  My all time favorite is the Affagato with Espresso gelato....YUMMY!!!  This is the spot to hit when in need for some caffeine :-)

The gelato is excellent! There's a plethora of flavors to choose from with some sugar free choices as well. We shared coconut and mango and were delighted with how they tasted so rich and fruity. Even though their prices are a bit on the expensive side, their gelato is definitely the perfect treat to have while strolling through the Palazzo and the Venetian hotels.

Came in here for some ice cream. It wasn't bad but some were just too SWEET for my palette and pricey. But cant expect less from a location on the strip. Service was okay... pretty clean. Probably wont be coming here too often unless I happen to be nearby.

Came here to try the coffee and it was served it cute little illy cups. You have to ask them to serve it in the cups even if you say for here otherwise they put it in to go cups. Also got a crepe that was way too much. It was with Nutella filling, scoop of ice cream on top, and whip cream. Friend got a peanut butter cake which was delicious and moist, not dry!

Came here both times since it's always in my path going back and forth from casino to hotel.  Both times, the workers were rude and trying to rush you.  

Had the crepe the first time, which was good.  But the real star here is the gelato, delicious!

We stumbled upon the Expressamente Illy between the Palazzo and the Venetian.  Illy coffee is always a win, but we were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the apple cinnamon crepe, strawberry/banana/nutella crape and the ham/bacon/avocado crepe.  The butterfinger and butter pecan gelatos were also good.  Pleasant and professional staff. They were experimenting with a new drink, and gave us a full size to sample.  We were fat and happy when we left.  Trip salvaged.

I ordered a cappuccino but received a latte. The only reason I gave the 4 stars is because it was actually well prepared. Good microfoam and a tasty shot. I also ordered a single shot of espresso which was full of flavor from Mr. Illy the Master. I recommend this place as the best place to get coffee in the Venetian. The pastries are very good.

I wanted it to be so good so bad. We had two lattes and they weren't great. Pretty pricey, almost $16, especially since we added soy milk for one. They tastes watered down, not very strong. What I like was that it wasn't sweet at all, since I never add sugar to coffee.

Very poor service, over charged on items, tip added to bill after I left 20% tip, coffee was $8, pastry was dry, waffle order took 15 mins with no line and was wrong, however they did refund.

The fruit cup was delightful- fresh.

A good place to take a break in busy Yorkdale. However, prices as expected are insane. Bought a small palm sized cake and specialty drink, and it came up to $13 ish.

Tried their flourless chocolatey cake (don't really care about the flourless part, more like they ran out of everything else that was chocolate flavoured). It was good! But very small. Drink was yummy.

It is a good place to take a breather and drink some coffee since the tables are often empty (compared to Dine on 3 foodcourt one level up).
Great selection of gelato and you can also get a meal here if you choose to. Staff are nice and friendly. It is very conveniently located between the Palazzo and the Venetian.

My boyfriend and I stopped here for coffee after dinner at Cut.  This place is a modernized, Italian style cafe and there was an overwhelming amount of drinks, a beautiful display of pastries and gelato, and lots of seating areas.  I ordered a vanilla latte and my boyfriend ordered a cappuccino, so my review is solely for the coffee.  The barista was extremely friendly and accomodating to us as well.  Although it was a little pricey for coffee, Illy is a well-known coffee brand, and we definitely weren't disappointed with our drinks so it was well worth it.

After hours of hanging out at The Palazzo's Azure pool, i needed something cold and sweet so we stopped by Espressamente... Delicious! They also have crepes, paninis, coffee of course...but I will try these on my next trip to Vegs.

Must try flavors of gelato (I mean I guess everything right? hehe)

*Guava -- delishhhhhh
*Cappucino flavor - very very delishh
*Tiramisu
*Mint choc chip

SERVICE: I wish I could have gotten the name of the man who helped me choose but he was so nice! He suggested the strawberry cheesecake and it was the best flavor out of them all! I wanted to get two flavors in a small but it wasn't allowed. He let me have both flavors anyways so of course I tipped! 

GELATO: like I said, it was pretty good! Not as smooth as other gelato I have had but still a nice little dessert to treat yourself with while in Vegas!

I have a long history with the illy brand, before decent local roast became popular.
The unmistakable steel canister easily stands out from the rest in the coffee aisle.
Through illy, I made my first significant expenditure in kitchen machinery asset.
I call him "baby blue".

A global brand, international chain and it fits quite well in it's new Yorkdale home.
It's as good as I remember if not better than the other Airport illy's I've visited.
I happen to be at Espressamente illy through their opening period and could not resist.
Baristers wait at doorway to offer samplings of food/snacks but that was not for me.

I walk in and skip the line to look upon their backwall of gadgets and espresso cups.
It seems most customers are there for consumption and less on merchandise.
I browse for good 5 minutes without any interruption and slowly carefully examine.
Y1 machine is not my style and direction is getting too tassimo-like.   3.5'd

Anywho, I'm not there to rate merchandise nor food but the main attraction, COFFEE!
$4.00+ for my cup of cappuccino as much as it hit the spot, I thought slightly $$$.
Made perfectly and enjoyed relaxingly in such a trendy chic modern environment.
Wait-a-minute. I didn't get to enjoy that until I got my order, which they forgot.
I stood there waiting awhile, at least I got to see how confusing they were at the line.

I have out-grown illy canisters as a home brewer many many cups ago.
However I am more than happy to see this old aquaintence once again.
Brings back so many memories, however hyperactive it may be.

This cafe is okay, everything is pricey. A coffee can easily cost 3-4 bucks, a regular crepe is about 10 bucks. Everything taste alright, nothing special at all. It's another self-serve cafe on the strip. The tables and seats are usually pretty dirty with crumbs like nobody ever clean them. The only nice thing is its location with all the nice stores around.
I love illy coffee and affagato is always good ... But not too much to rave about here

I LOVE their AFFOGATO!!!

A scoop of vanilla gelato and a shot of hot espresso.. YUMMY! It just goodness that melts in my mouth. I'd love to come here everyday if I could, but I make sure whenever im on the strip or at the Venetian that I stop by and get me one of these.. 

Their selection of gelato is also pretty good, I've had the most amazing pistachio gelato there.. yum!

We stopped by Espressamente for some Gelato over the weekend. They have 54 flavors, ridiculous! That's almost like Baskin Robbins TIMES TWO! It was so hard to choose which one I wanted. I thought I'd have a lot of time to pick since the line was out the door, but it went by super fast. I ended up getting Pistachio. My parents got guava and Donald got hazelnut in a waffle cone. I enjoyed the Pistachio very much. The flavor was spot on; It was almost like eating a giant pistachio nut. The hazelnut was very rich, creamy, and flavorful. After taking turns eating the pistachio and hazelnut, I tried the guava and it was a little too tart for me, but it tasted exactly like guava should. Having gelato here was definitely a nice refreshment after only eating frozen yogurt for so long. The solid flavors really make my mouth tingle with delight. They also have lots of other goodies like pastries, crepes, sandwiches, and lots of coffee drinks if you don't want gelato.

I thought this was going to be bomb bc I enjoy the canned Illy, but it was Illright.

Look to spend about $5.50 on a small espresso drink.

Long lines but it goes fast.

Extensive gelato and coffee selection. They also have some breakfast and lunch options, as well as crapes that looked amazing from the display case. 
 
I got the Affogato (hot espresso lungo over two scoops of gelato). My gelato choices were chocolate and pistachio. I really enjoyed this treat, but how can you go wrong with combining coffee and gelato. 

This place is located at the connecting point of the Palazzo & Venetian, but part of the Palazzo side. 

Picture of the treat has been attached for your visual pleasures. 

Will be back again when in the Begas.
Good for a quick coffee run.  Service is awesome for the second floor coffee shop in the Palazzo.  Pastry selection is okay.  Better as an apothecary.
Had two espresso drinks and a crepe with Gelato (chocolate crepe with peanut butter gelato, awesome).  Everything was off the charts good. Great taste and great environment to just relax for a bit.

Stopped by for coffee but their menu looked good. So my coffee stop turned into a lunch spot! Conveniently located inside the Venetian, clean and friendly. I had the Turkey avocado sandwich, chicken pesto crepe, and an ice latte. The turkey avocado is a classic, the side salad was super fresh, but the chips were way too salty. The crepe was surprisingly tasty too! But the iced latte was okay.

+1 for coffee.  
-1 for gelato.  
+1 for variety.
-1 for sandwich quality.
+1 for being in Palazzo.
-1 for having Palazzo pricing.
+1 for late night, after gambling/clubbing hours.  
-1 for attracting gaggles of drunk-assed Tara Reid wannabes.
+1 for being near the garden & fountains where you can sit.
-1 for being next door to CUT & its ignorant, sheep-like clientele. (See my review)

I don't know how judge this place.  I've clicked back and forth between 3-stars then 4-stars then 3-stars then 4-stars over and over again.

SO WHAT?  HOW WAS IT?
There's no secret to this place. It's a high-priced, semi-exotic coffee, gelato, crepe, and panini shop.  It's just a branch of the Illy shops in Italy and the rest of Europe.  The difference of course is that even with the exchange rate, coffee in frickin' Milan doesn't cost as much as in the Palazzo location.

The sandwiches do sort of remind me of salami sandwiches that I'd get while travelling from Milan to Torino or Cervinia in Italy.  But none of them are really very good.  The gelato is the same.  All melt too quickly and there's less of a selection compared to Cocolini's.   And none of them really stand out.

THE CRUX IS THEIR COFFEE:
Speaking as someone that travels to Italy often, going to Espressamente Illy for coffee at the Palazzo is kinda like going to a McDonalds in Japan.  You start thinkin',  "Who in got's name pays $8.99 for a gotdamned Royale with Cheese?"  Then when you taste your burger, you find yourself goin', "WTF?  This ain't no McDonald's Royale with Cheese."  And then you eat it anyway.  Because you spent $8.99 on it.

Coffee at Illy IN ITALY is really good pretty much across the board:  Smooth & lip-smacking tasty.  Italian coffee in general puts Starbucks' liquid burnt umber to shame.  Nothing beats having a cup of hot Italian coffee off the ridge of an untouched mountain of frost in the Italian Alps before you snowboard down it and cause an avalanche subsequently burying the rural village below and creating mass hysteria and mayhem.  Just like the Green Goblin.  Yeah.

But I digress.  This Palazzo shop doesn't represent Illy coffee well, I'm afraid.  I get the feeling that they don't change the coffee as frequently as they should because cups of coffee here frequently taste a little bitter and have a bit of an acidic aftertaste.  Very un-Illy like, IMO.

But on the other hand... it's the best coffee available.  I mean, you don't wanna go to Starbucks and their hideous Crappuccino, do you?  You'll be hard pressed to find a better cup elsewhere on the strip.  And every time I cross over from the Palazzo to the Venetian to play Blackjack, I get a cup to go.

CONCLUSION:
Darth Vader is Luke Skywalker's father.  That's the only secret insight I've got to share with you because Espressamente Illy has no secrets and is pretty much a "what you see is what you get" kind of place.  It's just a plain, ol' ordinary late night snack shop - not really at the same level of quality as its Italian brethren.   I come because it's on the way to my blackjack tables.  You'll probably come for some reasonably good coffee if you dread Starbucks... but that's it.

3-stars.

After our dinner at LAVO, we decided to go get some dessert at Espressamente Illy because of some of the reviews I saw from my fellow yelpers.  We were tempted with LAVO's dessert selections, but i kept insisting on trying this place out to my friend because of yelp... I have officially become a real yelper where my world revolves around reviews I have read and my bookmarks that I try to follow!!!

The place is definitely cute and bright.. nice decor.. very modern.. it is right in front of the Palazzo fountain where the mini shows are held at certain times.  We just in time beat the long line.. As for the gelato, I've had better.. We sample tasted few of the fruit flavors such as mango, lime, pineapple but it wasn't as sour as i wanted those flavors to be.

It was expensive though.. about $10 for the strawberry and nutella crepe with additional strawberry gelato ice cream on top.. It's okay it was good. A bit too strawberry jammey for me though inside of the crepe.  My friend had some pastry which was very light.  It balanced out the super sweet crepe i got.  I expected more out of this place and more variety in desserts/pastries so I was a bit disappointed.  We would of preferred staying at LAVO to eat desserts.

There was a little boy roaming around the venue though.. He was all by himself. We felt bad because he sat at the table next to us all alone.  He seemed very mature for his age, drinking his tea and eating his gelato.  The workers there were very hospitable to him.  I think his parents leave him alone too much to go off gambling... :( bad parents... all i wanted to do was to tell him to join us.. haha but if he was mature as he seemed.. he wouldn't of talked to strangers!!!!

Um this is a five star yelp.  You might as well get it here since it's the same price it is everywhere in the casino.  They actually had espresso drinks I'd never seen before.  They should make more of these in cities like San Francisco, Los Angeles & New York.

I used to love coming to this place. We would fly in from LA just to have their amazing sugar-free gelato! But guess what, they stopped serving sugar free gelato now!  Wtf Illy? What gives? No sugar free options at all... Not even one??? I recommended this place to so many people over the years, but never again.  So disappointed in you Illy...

Their Gelato was airy and not really that great, most flavors were too sweet AND creamy while lacking in bold flavor

$6 plus for a single scoop?! they have tons of flavors but I wasn't impressed 
---mint chocolate chip: ehh just okay
---cappuccino: I usually like a good espresso flavor but this along with the Nutella coffee flavor were too sweet!

Meh just here for convenience when you're stuck in the hotel

Well for those that know me, they would tell you that I never pass up the opportunity to have a cup of coffee. I have really come to love the selection here, they have a coffee for all occasions. Like for lunch I prefer a specially coffee with a fancy name, but for breakfast I like just a plain coffee. The lunch menu is a great one, the sandwiches are tasty and filling, plus there is a vast selection of drink to suit all tastes. 

The location is fantastic for lunch as there is a nice view overlooking the mall hallways, the renovations to the mall are great! I do recommend this place as will be going back many more times.

Located in the Shops at the Palazzo

Hands down the best gelato (or ice cream for that matter) that I have EVER had.  I don't care where I am staying on the strip I will make my way to this place to have sugar-free almond gelato.  While I am in line, I envy the crepe's that are being made and all of the coffee drinks.

This past weekend we went with some friends and I brought one of them here.  I bragged about it - and you know how when you brag about something then it has high expectations to meet and the person isn't impressed?  Well that DID NOT happen in this case, she was blown away!!!

She said, and I quote, "Why did we have crepe's this morning, we could have come here.  Why did we eat dinner we could have just come here and got gelato".  And I agree.  That one small cup of gelato is so intense with flavor that I don't need to eat anything else!!!  And Sugar Free too?!  This is what heaven is made of (I hope!)

One cup of gelato runs about $6 out the door but it's so rich and flavorful that it's worth it.
Awesome chai latte! Blows Starbucks's out of the water. White peach gelato and the pecan pie was very tasty too. Definitely will be back.

Nice atmosphere but drinks suck. I got a $7 cappuccino that had about 1/4" or less of foam on top. Thats clearly not a cappuccino. Nice atmosphere but the baristas have no clue or care of what they are doing. With that being said I still haven't had a good espresso drink in Vegas yet..
Finally a place that can make a good espresso without the sourness and bitterness. The gelato was excellent also!

Beautiful cafe with fresh crepes, gelato, sandwiches, pastries and delicious Illy coffee drinks. The "Amore" which is their version of an Irish Coffee (non-alcoholic) sent me into a sugar coma. Imagine amaretto at the bottom of the glass, then a shot of espresso and fresh whipped cream on top. Sip the espresso through the cream and you'll be so full that you won't want anything else.

But save room for some gelato too... or have an Affagato to satisfy your craving for both. It's 2 scoops of gelato with espresso poured over. Yummm...

It's a beautifully bright and cheery place. Do a little shopping at Barney's and then walk across the way to this place. You'll love it.

The place feels very Italian in its set up.  I enjoyed what I had here, but found a bit of frustration in the ordering process.

Went for breakfast and wanted to order a crepe. Crepes weren't available for another hour, although it didn't say that anywhere.  We also ordered a double espresso and a "make it large" macchiato.  I was told the macchiato would have to turn into a latte.  Fine. Just make it!  We also shared a bacon and egg bagel sandwich. Total bill was close to 16 bucks!

Our number is called and we have our drinks in paper cups!  I bristled at that; for 16 bucks, give me an effing glass, especially since I ordered it for here.  The girl says, "I didn't charge you the 'here' fee."  What?!?! There's an extra fee! Where is that on the menu? And, frankly, I ordered it for here, give it to me for here. They did finally put our drinks into glasses. But damn, what a hassle!

On another day, we shared a nutella-banana crepe. It was yummy!

The set up of the place is good, as is the quality.  The service, however, needs to be augmented.

I like Illy coffee a lot and the quality of the coffee itself is ok. But $6 for a 12 oz beverage is just insanely overpriced. An "Upgrade" to 16 oz costs $1.85. Plus the staff is indifferent at best. Still, if you're staying at The Palazzo, this is your best option for a take-out coffee.

Most disorganized coffee shop I've been to. In line to order a cappuccino employee finished with person in front of me then says just a second then proceeds to go take ice cream orders from people who had gotten in line after me. Don't mind waiting if there is a system but not cool with waiting and then having employees cherry pick who to serve from random spots in line.

Horribly, nasty vile and those words are just for the bitch behind the counter. The gelato here is just disgusting.. after 2 bites it hit the trash. Also, VERY over priced.. over 8 bucks for 2 tastes.. chocolate looked awesome though tasted like it come from a powder.. sort of like frozen Ovaltine. Also tried the lemon.. it had that weird fake lemon taste.. pretty shop in a pretty hotel. Unforgettably its all window dressing.

Affogato! Yes. I needed that little kick and a seat by the waterfall fountain in the Palazzo. And the gelato was delicious - I chose stratciatella and chocolate. $8

They also make smoothies. Honey, you're getting PINEAPPLE right? I raised an eyebrow and smiled. It wasn't long before we went back to our hotel - and I had the energy after strolling the strip.

Their crepes here is unforgettable although they don't top it off with ice-cream and is worth 12$ I feel like you could get a better deal somewhere else. But it's a convenient location since it's right inside the plazzo

Really fantastic gelato with lots of flavor options here. I got the bascio which was chocolate and hazelnut, sort of a frozen version of Nutella. This place is small with not a lot of options for seating, so it's more of a grab and go. Which is fine, since there is plenty to walk around and look at outside!

You're in the Palazzo and you need that caffeine hit?

Nice space, crowded but you could do worse. Hopefully you can camped out a seat amongst the Euro tourists. Wifi is helpful.

Definitely not a fan. And I absolutely love Illy coffee. I loved it when I visited Greece... It reminds me of my wonderful trip!

Service at this spot was pretty crappy. People in there didn't care that you came in and didn't even bother to acknowledge you... They pretty much ignored me until I walked all the way up to the counter and stood there looking at them. 

It's nice that it's located right by the "Love" sign so you can kind of sit around and people watch. My fiancee got the cappuccino and I got something called the "amour" that made me feel a little ill. It was some kind of Irish style coffee - but for some reason it was served lukewarm. I was expecting a hot coffee. And then it was piled to the brim with not whipped cream, but some kind of whipped... clotted cream? It was pretty bad.

Went here @10am on a Sunday.  Had waffles, omelettes, and sandwiches on the menu.  Tried to order an omelette and a waffle, "sorry we don't sell those anymore, we stopped over a month ago".  What the hell!  Why is it still on the menu?  Ordered out of convenience a breakfast sandwich and a muffin.  Muffin was about 3 days old and the sandwich had lunch meat on it.  Save your time and go around the corner to Starbucks.

I adore this place.
Such wonderful service, and such yummy foods! and ohmygoodness the sundae I had was to die for. MUST VISIT THIS PLACE, when you stay at The Palazzo. It is expensive, but damn it it's worth it. VERY WORTH IT.

The customer service isn't good, I asked about the snack  menu and the guy told me food court !! Really ! You don't want me to eat at the cafe !? 

I ordered a tuna salad which was really yummy ! 

Nice cafe, but it would be amazing if they hire people with good customer service.

Sooooo so delicious, crape with Nutella banana and strawberry and a delicious illy cappuccino. 
The extra scoop of ice cream was way too much and ask for only half the Normal amount of Nutella to reduce the overly sweetness of it.

Dear Palazzo's Illy,

       I do appreciate your variety of flavors of gelato and free sampling and lovely cashier personnel, but the old lettuce in your sandwiches must go. I can't believe how wilted and brown the lettuce in my turkey wrap was. It wasn't really edible because the bitterness from the lettuce overpowered everything else. Please keep up with quality control, I'll be back shortly to check up on your progress.

Thanks.

I stopped by this place looking for some coffee. I must say that I don't have complaints about the coffee. It is what you will find at most coffee places (average). The prices, however, are a lot higher ($7 for a latte). What is not average, however, is the service. It was horrible. There were two people behind the counter, both of them needing to pretend they liked being there. A lot of the prices are missing or they will display the price of the smallest portion and then ask you if you wanted a large. The girl behind the counter had a bad attitude. She got really bothered when I asked the price of something as if I was just supposed to get it and pay whatever.
I give it three stars, because while the gelato I had was delicious, it was really expensive (too expensive for what it was) Alas, it's Vegas, but still.

OH MY WORD! I paid a little more than $8 bucks for 2 scoops of ice cream. The ice cream was not that good. it was fine, but I've had much better from BEN AND JERRY'S. People. Come on. When I can buy better ice cream from a grocery store, please up your game. 

The only thing that made this trip worth it that the guys working the ice cream were super surly and I could almost pretend that I was in France. Oh wait, except I was supposed to be pretending I was in Italy. Yep, fail again. 

When you walk past this place, just keep right on walking unless you are dying to pay a lot of money for ice cream that isn't worth it.
Good, but not great.  I tried the mocha before hitting the car to the airport.  When in need of caffeine, Illy will do.

The coffee was delicious.  Small, but exactly the same size as every illy espresso I've ever had in Europe.

The crepe was under-cooked.  It tasted like batter.  It was chewy and yellow.  Even the chocolate and banana did little to make up for the under-done crepe.

The ice cream looked lovely, but I didn't have any.

I was quite displeased with the service.  The person at the counter put out the lunch paninis and salads, but would not sell one to my sister as it was 11:50 a.m. and they would not be selling them until Noon.  Um, but they were already prepared.  It was an odd experience.  The girl serving us didn't appear to know their menu at all.  

Customer service, when I'm spending $11 for a crappy crepe and a good cup of espresso, should be good.  And it wasn't.

A 4 of 5 ... but close to a 3 because of price. But then again, remember it is within a high-end resort. 

Espressamente Illy is the perfect light fare, coffee and crepe shop (and Itlalian ice cream - gelato) in the Venetian to Palazzo corridor. 

The lattes and cappuchinos are made very well. But for us, it was the crepes, specifically, it was the Strawberry with Banana crepe, and the Apple Cinnmon crepe ... mmm!

It's always nice to encounter a good tasting item that is new or original or different in taste.

We have yet to try the gelatos as an ordered item but we did have a sample spoon or two - good stuff!

This is my go-to place when I am craving ice cream before work (its located right downstairs from my place of employment). They have delicious heath bar and caramel gelato...plus their waffle cones are darn tasty. They are on the expensive side (what do you expect...its located in one of the nicer hotels on the Strip) but if you happen to work in the Venetian/Palazzo and show your ID card you get 50% off....even then its still pricey. So...if you see a tall red head in all black noshing on a double scoop in a waffle cone headed up the escalator you know its me :)
Small cafe but great products. Clean and modern set up. Friendly staff. Little expensive but that's Vegas. A great quick stop for a caffeine fix!

I used to love this place.  Perhaps my taste buds changed over the years.  The half and half drink I always order just seemed WAY too sweet and the service is rude.  We came here on a Saturday night during the New years weekend and the place was crowded with at least 20 people in line.  There were about 5 people working that night and I can sense the tension amongst the workers.  Then again, who wouldn't be stressed out during a major holiday weekend?

After I got my drink, it was overly sweet and wanted more ice in it.  I asked the first guy behind the counter for more ice and he pointed towards the other female barista.  I walked over to her and she gave me this angry look.  She said she was busy and had to serve the other customers first.  I asked again after she was done serving that other customer and she argued why I need more ice in my cup.  I told her it's because the drink was too sweet and she argued back saying that's the how it should taste.   I asked her to just give me extra ice and she finally hands me a cup of ice.  

Yes I understand people working during the holidays are stressed out but why argue about a simple request such as extra ice?  It's not like I asked her to make my drink all over again.  All she had to do was hand me a cup of ice.  Done.  Simple.  

If a family of 4 orders drinks/gelato here, be prepared to spend close to $30.  It's not cheap but you get pretty good quality for what you pay.  However, I was quite disappointed with the service and how I can't have my drink the way I want it.  Less sweet.

Aside from Bouchon's brew, Illy's the spot for caffeine. At Illy, you'll find your lattes, mochas, and regular coffee. The prices are above average of what you'll find at a chain, but the drinks are good. I'd suggest sticking to the beverages and skipping the foods -- not the cafe's forte. 

Another weakness to note about this cafe is its service, and it's one thing that I dread whenever I come here. I get this feeling like I'm about to order my Caffe Latte from a Soup Nazi-esque barista. Exaggerations aside, don't expect warmth from the service here, but do expect decent beverages.

This IS the cafe at the Venetian/Palazzo for espresso and delicious treats.  True Italian coffee prepared in the Italian tradition.  Super friendly and fun staff.  The pasteries are oh so good.  Also, a huge, yummy selection of gelato.  Espressamente illy is a must visit!

The person I was with just won some money from the casinos, so we decided to indulge in a little gelato. I got a scoop of chocolate hazelnut gelato. It was so rich and delicious! It tasted just like a Ferrero Rocher! I could eat this everyday! it's expensive though...

I came here to get some dessert with friends. After sampling a few different flavors of gelato, I got the matcha flavored gelato which tasted so good! The only downside is the price. I don't think I can justify paying $7 for one scoop of ice cream again. 

They have a seating area which is nice so you can sit down and chat with friends over coffee/dessert. 

I probably wouldn't come back again just because of how pricy it is, but the gelato did taste very good though.
I love the European feel, their great espresso machines, and tasty espresso. The only con is their ridiculous prices, but while on vacation in Vegas espresso is a necessity!

Very good to excellent espresso, excellent crepes (mixed berry please), meh prices ~$5.25 for a large Americano, and a little hard to get the crew away from the TV (okay, Mexico has a match in the World Cup...how much can I fault them?).  I would never make them a daily experience because of the premium prices, but as a treat?  I recommend them.

Was on the mood for something sweat and luckily came across this cafe. Service was fast and friendly. I ordered a passion fruit Gelato. It was delicious and reminded me of my favorite Gelato vendor on Corso in Rome. Delicious to the last bite.

Blah.

I expected better... much better.  After all, this "Gourmet" place is inside the Palazzo.  They charge WAY too much for their gelato, and extremely too much ($~5) for ONE chocolate dipped strawberry!  Sorry, ain't worth it.

Plus, my gelato had little pieces of ice in it... it's almost like the ice cream that you leave in your freezer for months, and when you finally get around to it, it got freezer burn with little ice crystals.

Sorry, love the atmosphere and all, but I expected much, much better from this place!

Great cafe above the hustle and bustle of Yorkdale. Excellent coffee and fantastic deserts. Not sure what the reserved signs on the tables are doing in a mall coffee shop, but just move them and get on with life.

We arrived in Vegas and were ready to shop, but we needed a little sustenance first.  We were looking at the Venetian/Palazzo map when an employee asked if we needed help.  We told her we were looking for something quick to eat and she directed us to Espressamente.

There was a good selection of food to choose from....crpes, sandwiches, wraps, desserts and gelato.  I ended up getting the Italian club wrap( http://static1.px.yelp.com/bphoto/rmfDHoAyYCOlM0ELJmur_g/l ) and a bottle of water.  The wrap was pretty big and very filling.  No desserts for any of us.  We had dinner a few hours later, so we didn't want to overdo it.  The gelato seemed to be a hit, though.  

My lunch came out to $12.92.  Not too bad considering it was Vegas.  It was definitely a good spot for a quick snack.  Next time I'll try the coffee and gelato.

I had the Vanilla Latte both days I was here and it is so much better than Starbucks.  It is more bold, flavorful and aromatic.  The flavor is richer and more intense.  I am in love.

They also have a nice selection of food and pastry items and they start serving gelato at 11:00 AM.

The biggest gelato bar I have ever seen. The shop has been revamped since the last time I visited. Looks very modern and stylish.

Love the board of coffee combination they have up. Intrigued by their Afagato (2 scoop of gelato w/ a shot of espresso) we ventured here after dinner for a treat. 

The cold and warm along with the sweet and bitter contrast is really something to experience. Coffee and gelato -- all my favorite in a cup. Perfect treat for me.

I went here today for something sweet for my co workers and I. The gelato here is amazing! I suggest trying it, however it will be pricey. $7 for a small cup. It was worth it. I tried the Spumoni, and the Mango flavor.  Ended up getting the Tiramisu, and my co worker got the Mango. A must try if you are going to the Palazzo. The staff is also super friendly and encourage you to try as many flavors as you want.
Only had the coffee... loved it. Better shots than Starbucks.

For years I had always thought the best gelato/ sorbet was found in the Bellagio Gelato near their swimming pool. Now I can say that this place has now won number one in my book for Strip sorbet. Located near the casinos in the Paulazzo, you usually have to wait in long lines but let me tell you it is worth it. The Prince of Taiwan is lactose intolerant so I only tried their sorbet. Got the mango and pineapple, and dear Buddha , it was as if I was eating the fruit, just softer and more cold. It was heaven on earth for me that day, and even all the big breasted cougars roaming the casinos looking for cubs could not detract me from having a love affair with my sorbet at this wonderful little gem.

So I came to this place because the Starbucks downstairs didn't have available seats for me to sit with my laptop and get some work done. So I wandered the mall and found this place. 

I ordered a pumpkin spice latte which was served in a tall glass rather than a mug. Therefore it was pretty hot to hold and drink. And then chose to sit in the corner so I could finish my work, and while getting cozy in my corner I noticed a tray of mugs and dishes lying flat on the table next to me. I thought a server would eventually pick it up and take it away but after sitting here for 30 mins, the mugs were still there. I really did not get a good impression from this place. They played some funky music though, so that was nice.

Caramel Macchiato  - AMAZING! I like getting stuff that is strong but doesn't taste too much like coffee ... and this was the perfect drink! I didn't have to add sugar or anything.. it was ready to drink... just how I like it!
$6.75 for an one scoop ice cream cone.  It tastes ok.  It's a bit pricey but it's Vegas...

I went here a couple times while staying at Palazzo. The first time was for breakfast. I got a berry crepe ($12/$13) and it was hot and fresh but had way too much chocolate inside. Next time I'll tell them to go easy. Recently, we went for dessert and got a double scoop of cheesecake gelato. It was good and I like how they put graham cracker crumbs in the ice cream, but it was also really rich. I only go here because it's convenient but it's also very overpriced.

Pricey coffee, but if you've read my past coffee shop reviews, anything else on the Strip is better than Starbucks.  They do have a good selection of gelato and desserts to go with your coffee and it's got a great location at the Palazzo right where the Living Garden is located.  So after you pick up your drink you can just sit down and enjoy it right in front of the waterfall.  It's a nice pit stop when you need some sugar to keep your motor running.

The perfect place to grab a light lunch or relax with a coffee and pastry after doing some shopping. I make sure to stop by whenever I'm at Yorkdale! 

I've tried a couple of the pastries here but my favourite is definitely the cannolis - crisp, buttery shells filled to the brim with deliciously creamy ricotta filling, yum. Most of their drinks are pretty good as well but if you can't decide what to get, go for the iced white mocha. You won't regret it!! Sandwiches are cute and yummy but relatively pricey and not particularly filling. 

Prices in general are fairly high here but not unexpectedly so for Yorkdale; I'd say most of the drinks and pastries (except maybe the macarons) are worth the premium pricing though.

I really enjoy the crepes from this place and visit this place often because of that, but within the last year it seems that care for their service and quality of their menu has declined.  

Mainly the people behind the counter make it a horrible experience.  There are a couple employees that provide great service, but the majority are rude.

This was a nice little surprise while waiting for the Blue Man Group.  The store is very clean, and showcases the gelato for easier selection.  There are quite a few choices available. They have some of the fruit ices as well, so there is something for everyone.

I got a scoop of pistachio which was flavorful and creamy. It's not a cold as regular ice cream, but that helped me avoid the dreaded brain freezes I usually get from cold things. I definitely enjoyed my scoop. 

Hint, if you're with a friend that you don't mind sharing with,  you can get two scoops in one cup for a lot cheaper versus each getting a scoop. 

For some tasty gelato goodness, give this place a try.
Nice little eastern Italian style coffee shop.  They arent quick and the pastries are just ok, but a fun little stand up bar to meet up with friends or read your phone.

Well, well, well... ILLY! This place is overrated for its gelato and under-rated for it's coffee! Afterall, it is ESPRESSAmente, meaning ESPRESSO, hello?! haha

Time and time again, I come and get a nice coffee here, sit down, people-watch, and I notice a ton of people who just come to get gelato! Boy they are missing out. 

Prices are a bit high, though.  They don't come in sizes, they are standard small 6-8 ounce drinks that range from $6-9. 

This espresso is so rich and delcious! Regular Cafe Au Late is simple and soothing. Have not tried the Affogato (Espresso with Gelato), simply because of the calories, but I'm sure it's great!

I always order the Cafe Amore which is infused with Irish Cream and gives it such an amazing flavor! The top half of the cup is the irish cream cold foam and the hot coffee is at the bottom, and when you take a sip and both mix: *ANGELS CHANTING*

Absolutely a great place for coffee

Fantastico Expessso ,Cappucino and Gelato in Vegas

What? A Real Italian Cafe in America? No way?
Yes! It Is Right Here.
Very Authentic.
Just Like Italy.

This is Like A Mirage.
Real Expresso here with 
Stong Coffee Flavors.
They have the huge very expensive 
Expresso Machines from Italy here,
This is the 
Only way to experience real expresso,
You have to have a Giant 
$10,000 Car sized machine like they do here.

Starbucks & 99% of other places in 
America do not have these machines.

Highest ever Reccomendation.
Best Expresso/Cappucino/Gelato in Vegas 

Maybe West Of Missisippi
Easy Five Stars

Gelato. Pastries, lite lunch fare and of course coffee. I had a chocolate pastry, my wife the gelato. It was good, not great I have to ding them for the hidden charge for enjoying my cappuccino in the store. They don't charge this if you get it in a to-go cup.

This place surely has gone down hill compared to the last time I've visited. Before, there used to be a line. 

While its located in one of the "better" hotels and it looks the part, the service is wack and quality is not there.

I really shouldn't be paying close to $10 for 2 scoop of icy, crystallized, gelato.

Having gone to a buffet earlier in the evening, I didn't want another meal after watching Jersey Boys, but I wanted something.  Gelato seemed perfect!

It's pricey (of course, this place is in The Palazzo) and the service is as unfriendly as it can be.  My goodness, how can they let cranky people serve something as magical as gelato?!

So, for $7.50 I had a scoop of GUAVA and a scoop of MANGO.  YUMMERS ALL AROUND!!!

A very inviting dessert place inside the palazzo. They have ALOT of  
flavors. Many fruity flavors like papaya, green apple, raspberry...and
many milky flavors like caramel, hazelnut, chocolate, etc. The gelatos are the first thing that caught my attention but they also have crepes, sandwiches, cakes, teas and of course espresso!

But I only ended up getting gelato because it is my fave and weakness.
  
So..seriously the gelato there is really good all pretty sweet and  
tastes fresh.  I got a double scoop of stracciatella and spumoni. It is
one of  the best gelatos I've tasted (until the day I go to Italy).  The pistachio flavor tastes like a pistachio nut, it's the same exact flavor as if I were eating a bowl of cold pistachios..  Has real crushed pieces of pistachio. The chocolate chip is one of my all time favorite gelato flavors and espressamente's straciatella did not  disappoint! The spumoni is also something to rave about.

I am thinking of going back soon to try the crepes, they look delissh.
Goood caffeine kick for the morning. Organized cafe. No fuss and simple ordering. Perfect morning fix.
Pricey, but one of the best cappucinos I've had. The chocolate cake is great as well.

Overpriced coffee; I can get better coffee in Little Saigon for 1/3 of the price =)

Tourist trap so beware.
Great smoothie!! Great Espresso! Horrible horrible service!! The staff is rude and seems lost with what's going on!

I was staying at the Palazzo and walked by here multiple times, making my way to the strip through Venetian. This place kept catching my eye and once I found out they serve affogato, I knew I wanted one! This place is overpriced and expensive.. $10 for an affogato (espresso + vanilla gelato). They have a wide variety of flavors to choose from. I probably should've tried a few to get my money worth! 

The espresso was nothing special. Decent, but not worth the $10 spent. gelato was nothing special, but it was good in the espresso. Nicely balanced and shareable. I just don't think I would be coming back here based on their prices..

whoohoohoo! i thought this place was great! I haven't had gelato like this since a trip to italy (and i have tried lots since)! pistachio, raspberry, hazelnut and lemon over the course of 2days and they all tasted great-very light and refreshing.
and for those of you who can't or don't eat sugar: they have a nice selection of sugar-free gelato, all without that weird sweetener taste!

Loved my experience at Illy's. I sat here for a few hours to do some work after shopping on a weekday afternoon. There's plenty of seating, so it never got too busy contrary to the rest of the mall.

I originally ordered a medium salted caramel latte, but was informed that the happy hour combo could only come with a small and a choice of cannoli (I got chocolate chip). I think the worker forgot to mention that the flavour shot wouldn't be included either (or the salted caramel was very weak). Nevertheless, both my items were delicious, and I can't wait to come back to try more of their items.

When you're in Vegas during the Summer you have to find ways to cool off. One of our solutions was to enjoy gelato. Espressamente Illy is located in the Palazzo and after a walk on the strip we decided to make a stop before heading back to our room. 

What caught my attention was all of the flavors you can choose from. I definitely took advantage of the samples since I didn't know which one to choose. I ended up choosing the Spumoni gelato and sugar-free Mango sorbet. Weird combination, yes. I just couldn't decide between the two so I decided to get one scoop of each. I can't ever recall seeing Spumoni available at any other gelato locations. The Spumoni was true to taste and there was an even portion of flavors, there wasn't too much or too little of one flavor (flavors included pistachio, chocolate, and strawberry). The sugar-free Mango sorbet was refreshing. The Mango fruit was already sweet so having it sugar-free didn't make much of a difference in taste. The flavor I was looking for was Green tea and unfortunately Espressamente Illy did not have it. 

The good tasting gelato and sorbet does come with a price. Two small cups with two scoops of gelato/sorbet each came to about $16. 

The gelato/sorbet tasted like any others, nothing too specia. If I'm in the Palazzo again looking for something to cool me down I would consider coming back, but I won't be actively seeking to come back.

It's going to cost you more than you ever thought you would be willing to pay for ice cream/gelato, but this just may be the best you've ever tasted!

Yeah, it's like $12 bucks for a scoop of gelato.  You'll get over the price pretty quick when you bite into it....it's amazing!!  I always opt for the cappuccino flavor.

There are about a billion places on the strip to get your fix of cool treats, but Espressamente is definitely the best.  Great selection, fast service, and the tastiest gelato you will find!

The only star I'm leaving is because the crepe was so good.... But the service.... HORRIBLE, came here twice, and they were twice arrogant and unfriendly, they should hire customer service people, businesses depends on customers but these baristas are the rudest I've ever met.

My review is based on the coffee only. I wandered into the Venetian and found this place one morning after hubby didn't really like his coffee from bouchon bakery. I had two coffees the one that's most memorable to me is a shot of espresso inside of a small glass of hot chocolate. It was so good. The hot chocolate was so creamy and chocolately, it gave the drink a great chocolate flavor while delivering a caffeine jolt I'm always happy with! I am impressed with their coffee creations at this little dessert, coffee & breakfast place.

My friend and I went in and wanted a coffee and a sweet on a Sunday afternoon and the service was very poor. The baristas were talking to each other in another language (not Spanish?) and were really cranky and didn't smile. The gelato was boring, though there were many choices. I chose stracciatella and it was the worst I've ever had. The lobby was dirty and not kept up and it wasn't busy at all.

Their Sugar-Free Gelato tasted as good as any sugar included ice cream that I was able to eat before I became diabetic.
The chocolate was very rich, creamy and I couldn't have eaten any more than their serving, (which doesn't look large, but considering the density and richness of their product is perfect). 

The coffee drinks were the same price as Starbucks and tasted much better.

holy smokes? 

yes i know it's vegas and it's in a nice hotel, but damn, do you need to charge 3.5 for an americano shot? that's like more than a 1 dollar minimum poker table. i'm not a high roller, can't really afford the price for a shot if i'm there for a week. 

the price definitely killed it for me.

good prime location, lots of business, but lack of service and killer price (lightened the load of my pocket).

Saw 'affogato' on their menu, which was described as 2 scoops of gelato drowned in a shot of espresso. That sounded interesting so i decided to try it. Got 2 scoops of coffee gelato with it. Hehe

It was delicious. Sweet cold gelato with bitter warm espresso. Mmm. By the end of the cup, wat was left was a bitter sweet coffee smoothie. The coffee flavor was intense throughout. 

Also had their cappucino, which was nice and smooth. However, it tasted bland sincw the esspresso i was having was so intense. 

The only problem was their prices were quite expensive.

Gelato outstanding Latte was great 
Pastry was stale maybe it was the little woman serving it on Aug 8 2012 8:30am
Awful attitude

Looking no further than Illy for coffee stepped in here for a caffeine break done Italian style. 
 
Having frequented Illy many times while shopping and looking for a pick me up in the Grand Canal shops I have never eaten here.

Today this changed I decided to try their crepes. I ordered the Au Chocolat style from the crepes menu, plus a cappuccino Viennese. It so fancy for added whip on the Cappuccino. I decided to dine in since I was in no rush today. The crepes were good, but not the greatest. The Cappuccino as always Illy delivers in the coffee department with shining stars. 

The crepes they put way too much chocolate in the crepes. Plus it is canned chocolate and not real. The crepes themselves were cooked very well. By themselves the crepes would of been much more enjoyable without the chocolate. Either way the whip cream did leave a nice presentation for the crepes when served.

The staff was very friendly and pleasant. They are up on all the coffee lingo and will aid in questions of what is in this coffee and such. They provide very fast service for the food too delivery to the customer.

The dining area is very comfortable and all the tables were clean. They have outlets for charging out mobile devices by the front door. The music that plays is very soothing and relaxing. 

Such a great place to enjoy a good espresso, but shame on the staff for putting mine in paper cup. As many reviews state it's a hit or miss if one gets glass for that fabulous coffee in. You might have to ask.
They really don't know how to do latte.  They run milk foaming for more than 2 mins.  Disappointed.

I'm a fan of illy coffee. Their Americano ranks up there as one of my favorites.  Their Americano is strong, smooth, and doesn't have that bitter taste.  Bottom line...illy coffee is really good.  What I'm not a fan of is the high ticket price you're going to have to pay at Espressamente illy. A large Americano and a regular sized caf latte w/soy milk cost us about $15 after tax.  I can get illy a lot cheaper anywhere else.  But I get it.  The prices are jacked up because it's on the strip.  Vegas Baby!!!

TIP:  I got my Ballers Yelp Badge checking into this place.  

2017 Yelp Review #67

We dropped by here for an after dinner cafe.  I have been to Espressamente in Italy as well as here, and at the V.

I like the selection of cafes, sandwiches, crepes, macarons, desserts and gelato.  In addition, the Vegas locations are open until 1 am.  What I don't like are the prices.  A large cafe is $5, and it isn't that large.  Sandwiches are $10, crepes are $12, and the portions are not that large.

Nonetheless, you have to give Espressamente credit for its offerings which are quite extensive.  If there were one by my house, I would be a regular.  Plus, I love the color of the rainbow offerings w/ their gelato which I found to be very good on previous occasions.

It was almost $7 for their fruit cake gelato! I thought this was a super unique flavor. It had fruit chunks in it the way fruit cake does. I'm a sucker for unique flavors. Their gelato presentation isn't as great as some of their gelato competitors in the Venetian. There is some indoor tables but they are limited. They sell coffee and candied and caramel apples here as well. I tried their nutella flavor as well and thought it was way too sweet. Their tiramisu flavor was much better.

Eh, I guess if you have to, is how I feel about this place. We woke up late on our last day in Vegas and had a full day of activities planned (it was a family trip). We needed to grab something quick to eat so we could meet up with everyone. We got the sandwiches here and they were okay, nothing terrible, nothing great. I do appreciate that they are made to order instead of the ones that are displayed in the window case. They have a wide selection of coffee drinks which looked yummy and might be the best thing to get here. They also have a ton of different gelato flavors. Not the best gelato on the strip by any means, but tasty enough. A little too artificial tasting for me. Overall, not the best place to eat, but decent when you need something quick.

LOVED THE GELATO! I didn't have any coffee here, but I did have the gelato and let me tell you it - IT IS PRETTY DARN GOOD. 

I tried the Mixed Berries ( very sweet with lots of berry flavors, mostly raspberry), Mango ( it really tasted like mango!) and the white peach ( a little too bitter for my taste). 

The service was quick and efficient. There wasn't a whole lot of seating and it was dimly lit on the inside. 

I'd for sure come back to this place on my next adventure in Las Vegas.

Yes, it's expensive and the prices are jacked up to take advantage of the tourists, but yes, the coffee is killer! As a Las Vegas local, I frequently make the trip down to the Strip just to get my macchiato fix. There's no other coffee quite as authentic as Illy. Since I can't afford to travel to Italy that often, shelling out $4 for an espresso doesn't seem so bad. They serve their coffee in REAL china cups which is important to me; I don't think coffee tastes as good in paper cups. And yes, you do have to pay an extra .50 cents for a "real" cup if you stay and drink in the restaurant. But that's okay, that's how it's done in Europe after all. The seating is very limited but there are several counters if you don't mind standing to slam your espresso. The gelato is decent too with several sugar-free flavors.

I have a love affair with good quality coffee and Illy is definitely my mistress.  

My husband and stayed at the Venetian, so every morning we had the privilege to walk to Expressamente Illy to grab a coffee.  It's a small Cafe located between the Venetian and Palazzo, right in front of the waterfall.  (Great people watching area). They have pastries and Gelato as well, but the star is the coffee!  Everything is freshly brewed to order.  The regular coffee is always a must.  Bold in flavor, but never leaves an aftertaste.  My other favorite is their hot mocha.  Espresso and milk mixed with rich chocolate.  So delicious.  My husband always gets a Cafe latte.  After trying almost everything on the menu, this was his winner.   

We've never had a problem with any of the staff being rude.  I'm not saying they were all smiles and would strike up a conversation with us.  But they patiently waited for our order and quickly got us in and out. 

Price wise, the coffee can be a little expensive.  With every place in Vegas though, it's going to be expensive!Suck it up and pay the money.  It's worth it.

Walking by on my way to The Blue Man Group, we spotted this place.  "Oh my, ice cream, I know what we're having for dinner."  After the show we walk over and it's not ice cream, but gelato.  Which is what exactly?  Watered-down, less-filling, not-as-good-as-ice-cream, frozen treat for twice the price.  They get three stars because my husband was happy-as-a-school-girl to have something cold and sweet to shove in his face.  I was not as impressed.  I had the mint chocolate chip and didn't even bother to finish it there was no flavor to it.

Mecca for espresso lovers, Vegas style. Located near the giant waterfall at the Palazzo, this place offers a wide array of gelato flavors, as well as creative espresso drinks that Illy is known for. I had the Affogato, which had espresso poured onto two scoops of your choice of gelato (I had cappuccino-flavor). My husband had the mint chip and spumoni gelato, which he really enjoyed.  The service was just fine. 

In short, our experience at Espressamente was molto bravo!
Cafe is good but the food is terrible.  Don't get a pizza it's crap.  On par with digiorno.  25$ for a pizza and coffee is outrageous.  Pass this place by.

My friends and I stopped by to quickly grab a crepe and coffee. This place doesn't operate efficiently- they had 2 employees on the cash register of which only 1 accepted orders- not sure why the other one was there. The third employee was proving samples for gelato and also making crepes. The last employee was making the coffee orders. 

The coffee employee was so focused on making sure the orders were being picked up instead of calling out the order number and then proceeding with other orders. 

Our crepes took 20 minutes to make not to mention the long line that was waiting to put in their orders. 

The crepes really weren't all that however the affogato was good. 


This place was good, clean and cute BUT they need to improve their speed- very slow!!

Well we stopped here for a quick breakfast bite. I ordered smoked salmon and cream cheese crepe and my husband got breakfast croissant. My crepe was absolutely delicious! My husbands croissant was cold and cheese wasn't even melted... So it's really I guess more of a crepe place and dessert

Waiting for friends by the waterfall so that we could go to Tao... we kept seeing people leaving Espressament Illy with yummy looking gelato. My girlfriend and I decided to go back the next day and get some gelato goodness for ourselves! There's SO many to choose from it's kinda overwhelming lol! They serve other items as well, caramel and candied apples, smoothies, drinks, etc...

I got the chocolate and vanilla gelato (one scoop of each). The vanilla was good... the chocolate had a funky aftertaste! I dunno... maybe I'm just picky... BUT it came with a cute little cookie on top that said "Ciao"... super adorable! You know I had a picture of that on Facebook lol! PRICEY though... I paid $9 for my little 2 scoop gelato (plus I tipped $2)... I think I said this in all my reviews tho... it's VEGAS!

"Ciao Bella!!!"  That's what me and my homegirls get every time we go to Espressamente Illy from the hot blonde guy.  Jeremy is my favorite Illy employee though bc he is so darned nice!  He always takes time to talk to me and has even introduced me to his wife.  I just love coming here and tipping the sh-t out of them.  The espresso and coffee drinks are out of this world- I mean seriously you'd think a unicorn spit in the drinks to make them so magical.  I frequent Illy at least once a week and it is the only place on the strip you should get coffee from if you are on the strip.  If you are staying at the Palazzo and Venetian and you are hung over this is your spot.  It is fairly pricey for coffee, pizzas, sandwiches, wraps and gelato or crepes, but this is Vegas and if you don't have money you shouldn't be in the Palazzo or Venetian anyways.  Just keeping it real for you.  I will never drink espresso or coffee from anywhere else when I am on the strip.

I can't even begin to express my joy that this place has opened. If you appreciate good coffee, then I strongly believe you will share this sentiment. For the coffee alone, this place is worth a visit, even if you try nothing else. 
I, however, DID happen to try both their caprese sandwich (buffalo mozzarella, tomatoes & genovese pesto on ciabatta, pressed) & their canneloni. Although I've had better elsewhere (not to mention the fact that you'd be hard pressed to screw up such a simple sandwich) I really enjoyed the freshness of the caprese sandwich. I've also had better cannelonis; the filling was great, the shell was not so much. 
That being said, the coffee is enough to keep me coming back.

It looks alot better than it tastes...

When I first saw this place.. I was in heaven..  It's great how they present everything..

They have alot of stuff there..  We tried a crepe with gelato.

The crepe was just OK.. for the price.. and my expectations based on the look of this place was...it was a letdown.  The gelato was OK as well.
This place isn't cheap. You're in the palazzo, and expected to pay top dollar.

The chocolate syrup used was mediocre.  I would go back to try something else though.. something HAS to be good.. right??

Love Illy coffee!  Smoooooooooth!

Had the Strawberry Banana Smoothie - it was so good on a hot day!

Free WiFi available in the little restaurant.

3 stars for the gelato itself. (there were ice spots in the gelato)

2 stars for customer service

Went here looking for some gelato to cool down and didn't want to walk all over the strip looking for a place since we were already nearby. There are a good amount of flavors to choose from and based off the samples, they are all pretty good. However, I was thoroughly upset with the service. The first guy who greeted us said hello then disappeared, only for another man to help us with minimal energy. He barely spoke to us and never smiled. Then after ordering, he basically yelled the total to me and threw my change at me when I paid. Incredibly rude.

After a horrible meal at Pickle Barrel I had to get something sweet to cheer me up. 

Grabbed a caramel latte, gingerbread cappuccino and a slice of chocolate cake.

I gotta agree with Kris U. - The prices are high and the cake slice was almost like a sliver BUT I was very pleased with the outcome.

The drinks were $5.50 each and both had great flavour.

The chocolate cake was silky smooth and rich in flavour. Very comparable to a Godiva cheese cake or Lindt chocolate. Pricey at $6.50 a slice but worth it if you want a good slice of cake.
Pleasant spot to grab a coffee and a sweet treat. Great quality baked goods and ample seating

not open until 1am.  
no crepes at 11:50 huge disappoontment
Lazy workers open but no service
dont go there NO service
For the price, I expected better food and drinks. Coffees just alright, I make better espressos at home..

AFFOGATO. Ohhhh man. Vanilla gelato + espresso. It doesn't get much better than that. It will surely make you smile inside and out. The perfect pick me up to get me ready for the drive home after two long nights in Vegas.

On a different note, their cappuccino cups are adorable beyond belief! This is as close as I can get to a real Italian cafe until I can actually travel there so I will probably return on my next Vegas adventure.

Wonderful coffee, tasty breakfast and lunch items, beautiful pastry, terrific gelato...customer service could be friendlier...I'm sure the staff is burnt out on tourists but they should reboot and try to get smiles on those faces and be friendly.

The affogato lived up to the hype. I got mine with hazelnut and caramel gelato, and it worked nicely against the bitterness of the espresso. It was around $6 for the affogato, so not bad when considering the place was inside the Palazzo. There are a ton of different gelato flavors, especially fruit-based ones, if you aren't into coffee.

I have extremely mixed feelings about this place.

Food: fanstatic selection of gelato and other cafe goodies!  I could spend countless trips tasting everything - the pear gelato was refreshing and super yummy.  5 Star

Prices: One two-scoop little cup set me back about $8 USD but I was on vacation so who cares, won't be doing this for a while.  3 Stars (especially in consideration that this was in the Palazzo)

Service:  I very seldom get offended but why would the cashier frown at me for trying to pay with cash (I am saving the establishment credit card fees), then roll her eyes at me when I asked for cup of water.  I had to approach a different cashier to get a spoon to eat my gelato!  Which garnered another eye rolling from the first cashier!  And not a single thank you from either - there were no other customers at that time.  0 Stars

Hmm not my favorite place on the Strip. Service was pretty bad... Most of the workers had attitudes. The crepes were just alright, and coffee was decent. Not worth the price for sure but then again it is located inside the Venetian.

Stopped by for coffee after shoe shopping with my mum. It's relatively new and serves both drinks and treats. Pricing is okay - not expensive, but not cheap. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but if I'm at Yorkdale, I'll stop by should I need a pick me up.

Good for: espresso, desserts, sandwiches

Gentlemen - if your girlfriend likes gelato and coffee, I would pretend like you knew about this place all along and take her here as you stroll through the Palazzo shops. Tell her to get the affogato - two scoops of gelato and coffee. She will love you for life once she tastes it.

I'm not saying that I knew about this drink/dessert. In fact, far from it - I don't even drink coffee. But, consider thanking me when you heed this advice on your indulgent foray in Las Vegas with your significant other.

This is a very conveniently located coffee shop in the shopping area between The Venetian and The Palazzo. You'll stumble upon it if you are walking by the area. My husband and I stopped in here for some coffee before going to a Cirque show. We're old so we were worried that we'd fall asleep at a 9:30 show. 

The shop is large and has a nice amount of seating. If the seating in the shop is full you could easily find a spot in the hall. They offer hot and cold coffee options, but also desserts, salads, and sandwiches. Everything is nicely displayed in the case so you can see what you are getting.

The employees didn't greet us when we came in or act friendly in any way. They did prepare our coffee without much of a wait though.

I went for a Vanilla Latte which was delicious. I really liked the taste of the coffee and the slight sweetness of the vanilla. My husband had an Iced Chocolate Mocha. He loved the flavor once he mixed up the puddle of chocolate at the bottom of the cup.

If you are an espresso snob, aficionado, lover, whatever then this is probably one of the best espressos i have had in America. It was perfect and I was sober. Thick, creamy, hot cup, sugar become one with the crema and not once could we see the black coffee underneath. Liquid gold.

We just stayed in Palazzo for 3 nights and this became our little go to spot for small treats and drinks.  I loved their gelato, especially the stracciatella.  Soooooo good in the chocolate dipped waffle cone.  My girls got crepes (berry and banana), frapes and other various coffee drinks that they seemed to enjoy.

Their breakfast menu was limited, so we went elsewhere for that, but overall a safe find for treats!

This seems to be the creme de la creme of all cafe chains and this particular location differs from the one in downtown LA in that it serves gelato - which, to me, is equivalent to sex.

They promise to offer the most authentic Italian cafe experience outside of Italy: they charge extra if you're going to use their cups, just how it is in Italy (shit, if my mom and grandma was with me, they'd stuff those cup and saucers in their fake Louis V bags.........go to mama's house and you'll see a slew of plates from various restaurants).

I only had the affogato (amazing!) which is typically a scoop of vanilla gelato topped over an espresso. It blends perfectly together and it pumped me up  for a baby-making project, especially when I saw that dee-luscious guy perusing through reports and sipping on his latte, mmm! Caffeine takes over where Cialis fails (not that I need it anytime soon; for all my third-legged bunch who are uber caffeine-sensitive like myself, you know it hits that area well). The espresso was rich and had the right notes to complement the gelato; it's coffee-flavoured ice cream, basically, for all you Starbucks folk. In addition, they have crepes and even more lattes, more gelato flavours, and espressos which I'm sure are phenomenal.

As for the gelato, it tasted like any other I've had: soft with little to no air and is creamier than the creamiest creams, haha. I was so drained that day after attending a convention nearby and this was a perfect spot to unwind and recharge. 

Service could use a little fine-tuning but I don't really care as long as they scoop it up and it leaves a good impression in my mouth, mmm! The affogato, you guys need to try.

This is a new must-stop for my frequent Vegas travels. Come here!

Unfriendly service?  I'm in complete agreement.  Gelato and crepes are two of the most delicious desserts around.  Why is the cashier so annoyed and only half-alive?  Bananas and chocolate with fluffy crepes.  Wonderful!
Such a large selection of cute sweets! Cannoli and macarons!! A bit on the pricey side, but the staff were all really nice. Sometimes, you really just need a sugar fix and some coffee.

Once again I was trapped inside the Sands Convention Center working a convention. On the last day of the convention I decided to give myself a little gift of an affogato. This time I got the vanilla bean (heavenly by itself by the way) and the cappuccino flavored gelatos. 

It is pricey, but it is worth it. The gelatos are just amazing. They are not mediocre and believe me, even though you are paying jacked-up fancy strip property prices it is worth it!

The only thing is that service this go-round was once again lacking. The employees just don't seem that happy. Perhaps it is because the place gets super packed during conferences and the employees get over-worked... but still, wish they were a bit more happy, they are serving delicious treats after all!

I heart Illy coffee already and now Espressamente Illy Cafe! Geez! Does life get any better than crepes, gelato, great espresso, and sandwiches?? 

I would pay their higher prices any day over stupid Starbucks! This place was so uber-cute and chic and everything was fresh and yummy! But, beware, your $20 can go fast here!!
Mediocre coffee . Staff is unpleasant and not helpful . You can tell they don't know anything about coffee nor care . Got my order wrong twice and wanted me to pay extra for their mix up.

I was able to split a small into two flavors, the caramel was flavorless but the stracciatella was good, crunchy in each bite from the chocolate churned in the ice cream.  5 bucks is pricey but expected.  I returned the next day to get a cup of coffee, stood in front of three employees having a non work related conversation.  I waited five minutes then gave up and walked away.  As I went up the escalator I could see they were still talking at the counter.  Gelato was ok, service was not, can't speak to the coffee as I couldn't get any.

DROOL...I stayed in the Palazzo which means that everyday I walked by this place and had to get something.  The lemon ice thing is really good as well as their chocolate and vanilla.  For ice cream though, they are pricy.
