Creamy and bursting with flavor!  The pistachio and mint chocolate chip flavors were my fave!  Cherry, not so good, but the lyche, watermelon, and pineapples tasted like the fruits itself!

Expensive, yes, but so is everything in Vegas.

My eyes could not stay away from this place everytime I passed it. Hence, I came here twice in one weekend. So many gelato flavors and drink options. If you're an espresso fan, I think you'll like this place just fine. 

The service here is a bit of an issue - they are slow and a bit aloof. But that's forgiveable considering it's just an order then sit place, not a big deal. It's also very warm in here, uncomfortably so. Don't know if it was just an off weekend....

It's a cute place to have a chat and eat some tasty desserts. I enjoyed their gelato and strawberry shake. Yummm. I am not sure how their savory foods or pastries are but they at least LOOKED nice. The espresso drinks are strong (duh), and tasted better than Starbucks (yeah I said it!).

You can buy Illy merchandise here too - limited edition espresso cups, coffee, gift sets, etc.
Very nice dessert shop inside the palazzo. Mainly gelato and crepes and other pastries. I had the peanut butter gelato and it was delicious. Very expensive though... About 6.25 for 1 scoop.

First off, the gelato was what really caught my eye from outside. I also captured the illy sign next to the main title. I love illy which is why I wanted to come try this place out.

As I walked in, the cafe was filled with coffee aroma with gelato into it. The variety of coffee was unique too! They had specialty espresso drinks. The espresso was not too strong because it had hot choco syrup at the very end which made my drink soo good! My gf had the spumoni gelato on a waffle cone which was soo delish! The workers didn't seem too happy. They looked like it they were ready to leave the place in a hurry. The lady was irritated and they didn't even stare you in the eye.

I would definitely come back for another drink...if I carry more money LOL

The gelato was delish! I had straciatella one night as a treat and went back again for a treat and got double scoops of tiramisu and cappuccino all of which were amazing!! Such a yum treat after a long work day! Definitely recommend.
The best coffee on the strip! I will actually go out of my way to have a delicious Latte from Illy. I wish there was one in LA.

Great coffee and espresso like you get at the cafe on the bridge on the Ponte Vecchio in Florence, Italy (I have been there).

Good service and nice surroundings.
I wish all the Starbucks in the US would be taken over by Illy.

Stopped by to get a caffeinated beverage and I saw the sign outside for the "Afternoon Snack" and when I asked the girl about it, she told me that it had ended...an hour ago.  :(

(Pet Peeve:  If deal is over, PLEASE REMOVE THE SIGN.  There is nothing worse than knowing that you missed a "deal".  Not to mention that it's somewhat misleading.)

Anyway, I prodded some more as to what I missed, how much it was, hint, hint, nudge, nudge.  Girl who took my order wasn't so sure about the price (~$6.50), but she told me that it included either a Cap/Latt + a cannoli.  JUST. SHOOT. ME. NOW.

It was around 7pm and there were a whack loada cannolis left.  How difficult would it have been to ask the manager if they could extend the deal for me to make some more money before closing time??!!

To me, it's a no-brainer, win-win situation.  Illy makes more money and I walk away a happy, fatter customer.

Great food! Fresh and always taste good !
The manager and his team here doing a great job! And of course the coffee is super good here. Can eat here breakfast lunch and dinner !!

This review is based on their gelato which was only A-OK.

So I was craving dessert like crazy in Vegas and especially something cold and creamy with it being triple digit weather there at the time. I initially wanted to check out Serendipity 3 and their frozen hot chocolate after I had been reminded of it by my friend Sally. But that never happened as Camellia C. said she preferred to go to New York for the original Serendipity.

Anyway, walking around the Palazzo to kill time after a big brunch at Bouchon had me fiending for gelato to cool down.  

At Espressamente Illy, two scoops of gelato will cost you around $7 and with that you'd think you'd get some pretty good gelato. It wasn't the bad but it wasn't as great as I thought it would be. Maybe it was because the Spumoni scoop was mixing with the Mango scoop to create an not so flavorful mixture of tastes. I still cleaned those bad boys out as the scoops are definitely on the small side. Which totally sucks when you just overloaded on the Rio Carnival Buffet's gelato bar the previous night. 

I wasn't going to leave Vegas without checking out at least one dessert place but I ultimately left unfulfilled and will have to come back to scour out different places for gelato/ice cream next time.

Espressente seriously TRUMPS Starbucks!! My favorite girl there, Jennifer, hands down make THE BEST latte I've ever had. As soon as she sees me, she starts making my coffee! I rave about her to all of my coworkers and clients who come into my store & I will continue to come back daily as long as the same excellent service she and Guillermo is carried on! These two & Jennifer's lattes are by far the best way to start & finish every one of my work days!!
The ice cream sucks. I ordered two scoops: strawberry cream and tiramisu. Not worth it

Food service is slow and limited siting space.  Cream of brocc soup was very good, but the "pizza" was barely ok.  I would give this place @ best 3 stars, but then on my way back from shopping; stopped and had the "affogato".  I went with hazelnut (my fav flavor) and it was topped off with espresso. Holy XXXX! What a great combo.  They have a ton of great espresso drinks so stop by and enjoy. A word of caution though, this is NOT Starbucks.  They do not have Frappacionos,etc.  Saw a couple not happy with their drinks (they complained @ the counter) as they confused Starbucks' "style" and "prep" with authentic espresso drinks.

Friendly staff cannot save this place for f'n up illy coffee.  Sure they use the same illy beans my local cafe uses, but the way it's brewed here makes it taste totally weak in comparison.  I think it was like $7 for my latte that wasn't strong and didn't have the rich flavor i associate with illy coffee.  i'll stick with Coffee Bean when i'm staying at Palazzo.

I've never had a crepe.  This was a shock and had to be remedied quickly.  The Palazzo/Venetian Shops were one of many stops during our Vegas adventure and a run through the rain made us hungry again.

This is dessert heaven.  Crepes, gelato, and espresso.  Yum!  We ordered the mixed berry and stood by to watch as it was made. The crepe is a thin delicious pancake drizzled with hot chocolate and topped with raspberries, blackberries, and blueberries.  It was a lot of chocolate even though I love chocolate but overall a yummy delicious treat.

Ordered a strawberries and chocolate crepe.  Crepe was not the best tasting.  Had strawberry "puree" in it as well as nutella.  The nutella was a nice hazelnut flavor, but that "puree" was effen disgusting.  Tasted like the filling for a Pillsbury Toaster Strudel...that mixed with the nutella was AWFUL.

Will never go back for that.  I might return to try some gelato or one of the many coffee drinks.

The crepe was pretty good. We ordered the strawberry -banana crepe it was $13.95 instead of the $12.50 posted on the sign. The cashier failed to mention that it was more money. I also order a cup of coffee and asked her if there was free refills if we ate there and she said, "yes" but when I went back up to ask for my refill they said it would cost $1.00. No big deal but it's not cool to tell the customer one thing and then charge them.

It's a cute modern coffee/dessert shop located inside of the Palazzo on the way to the Venetian. I'm not a fan of the gelato. I ordered pistachio and tasted a little artificial. Almost plastic. I heard the passion fruit gelato was great though. So my 4 stars is definitely not for the gelato. I had a small cup of cafe treistino (triestano?) and it was awesome. I opted to drop a packet of brown sugar in after the first couple of sips, but it was good without the hint of the sweetness. I could drink a cup everyday and it smelled so good. The love the decor. It's bright, hip, modern, chic, but not intimidating all rolled into one. I wished there was a place like this near work. I would venture over everyday for my espresso fixed even though I don't have a need to consume caffeine every morning.

Love that they have a huge selection of flavors.  Their gelato and sorbetto is pretty tasty as well but can be icy sometimes.  Really depends on your luck of the draw.  I think I would appreciate this place more if things were a little cheaper.  Overall, okay place for gelato considering you're in Vegas.
Here for a convention just eating my yummy turkey wrap ;) it did take a bit of time to get it but worth the wait ;) nice little deli atmosphere great portion sizes!

You can't get better than this place if you want real Italian cafe food and coffee. This shop is run by a wonderful Italian family who lives, breathes, and eats coffee. The reason why prices here and elsewhere on the strip are high is because rents are extremely high. I mean insanely high. It isn't because the shop owners are greedy. Bottom line, if you want a delicious coffee and dessert, go here.

Star is for the coffee only. Staff was rude and impatient. They all need customer service training. The strawberry and cheese croissant tasted like 5 day old bread. No joke. Very hard to eat and the croissant was heated up. I don't mind paying high resort prices but this was not worth it.

Very crowded. They have fancy coffee drinks that tasted ok. The crepe was ok but not worth the price. There was barely any nutella on it. I gave it high stars because the gelato was just terrific. I had hazelnut chocolate and i believe oreo. Overall i would go there just for the hazelnut chocolate gelato

Came by for coffee the other day and it was mediocre at best. For $6, coffee was overpriced...

The latte came out at a decent temperature, espresso was smooth and they tried to make it extra foamy.

Service was lackluster...maybe because they are inside a hotel on the strip?
With my feet killing me from my uber fabulous shoes, we stopped at Espressamente Illy.  The Marocchino Caldo made everything in my world great again ;) !!!

I went during a very busy time during Memorial weekend so I understand that it was crazy but I was happy with my experience because I didn't wait too long for my Affogato. I chose the Vanilla flavor scoop of gelato which was topped with their strong coffee (which I actually couldn't finish! Very rich!) and delicious whipped cream and espresso powder.

PERKS:

There are many outlets and USB ports available if you need to recharge during your vacation. Also was a fan of the decor.

Delicious coffee! There is definitely a Vegas/Italy mark up on their coffee though, it's quite expensive! 

Service was great and everyone was extremely friendly. I asked for half vanilla in my latte and it still was extremely sweet but they were very kind and remade it for me. Unless you like your drinks sweet I would definitely recommend going with half the flavor! 

We made this our go to coffee shop while staying at the Palazzo.

"illy". I love love you?
I don't love you back, ice cream. 

$5.50 for ONE scoop and another $2 for one more scoop. Served in a small cup that you can easily wrap your hand around. What has our world come to?

I got the pineapple ice cream, thinking it would be some Dole-pineapple taste. Wrong! There's barely any pineapple flavor! It's more creamy-flavored or some kind of coconut flavor. It's hard to even tell that it's pineapple without knowing you bought it. Not great.

The service was really rushed. The guy behind the counter asked us if we were ready while still skimming through each flavor. Everything looked good on the outside, but for $5.50/scoop, I think I'd rather go to Sbarro's or some Italian gelato/ice cream shop. Ciao, ciao!
Espresso at its best. Great location in the Palazzo, it is the perfect place for a pick me up!

Delicious coffee so hot, you won't taste it (or anything else).

Don't get me wrong, it's a fine product, illy coffee is one of my favorites; but here at the illy espressamente shop, they make it just a little hotter than they should. (Ten minutes later and I'm still burning my tongue trying to get a sip). I'm sure once it cools down a little (a lot) it will be delicious. I'm just not sure I have the patience.

strongest latte i've had in US ;-) not cheap, for sure, but that's vegas for you. my husband loved his macchiatos too :-) just like in italy...

we walked out cos it looked so fast-foodie but we went back in after recommendations from the Cut receptionist. so glad we decided to try it. we had coffee here twice and we'll try to have all future coffees in vegas here :-)

This cute little shop serves tons of gelato, desserts, and even espresso (I think they do the cream hearts here!). Like their little stand in the grand canal area, it's very pricey but it's refreshing and you just can't resist when in Vegas (when in rome - well, "venice").

Gelato is good, not the greatest - but they have tons of flavors to choose from, I'll have to keep trying.

They have tons of tasty looking desserts, sandwiches and coffee.

Good espressos, crepe was a little over cooked (more brown than tan)
Anyways, regardless of the higher prices here (being in the casino), the service could stand to improve a GREAT deal.  The folks behind the counter appear to hate life and treat customers the same way. If im paying $15 for a drink and crepe, i expect top level service, especially in the palazzo

Every time I come to Vegas, I stop in here for some treats.  

This place is a gleaming marriage between an Italian style cafe and Las Vegas pretension.  The inside is stylish and a bit on the cold side.  I wouldn't call it cozy, but it's a fine place to stop in and get some gelato or one of the many coffee drinks.  

The gelato, is, as some have said, not the best in Vegas, but they offer many flavors and the location is convenient.  The coffee drinks are served with such variety that I've been here about 4 or 5 times, always getting something different, and I still haven't made my way through them all.  From espressos flavored with chocolate to frozen coffee granita style, there's something for every coffee lover.

They also serve light lunch fare like crepes and finger sandwiches.

Illy is a great coffee brand, so it's no surprise that everything I've had here is of a decent quality, but you also pay dearly for that.  This place is far from cheap.

If you're a fan of Illy, or of coffee in general, I'd say this is a no-brainer.  If you're looking for gelato, there is better on offer elsewhere.

`BF and I have come a few times before for gelato but this recent visit I tried out the crepes. 

I had a nutella filled crepe with a scoop of hazelnut gelato on top. The crepe consistency was just right and Nutella with the gelato was just comfort at it's finest. 

The surprise was the BFs shake. He's been here enough to know the shakes so he cuts the fruit gelatos with some yogurt....he ordered this time half cherry and half yogurt. What came out was a drink delight that reminds me of those Asian yogurt drinks like Yakult...and I love that yogurty tangy flavor!

I tried to steal a few sips since dinner plus a crepe put me way over to even attempt to get my own.
yummy vanilla latte only downfall is its $7 for a small

Stale and tasteless macarons. Can't believe I paid that much just to get home and eat cardboard like cookies. I tasted a few and all they're all the same so I threw them out:( Such a waste, save your money and go elsewhere!!!! Disappointing since I was really craving them..

Cappucino's are consistently good but I was more than perplexed by what they call a 'dine-in' fee (check out a photo of my receipt). This basically means that it's cheaper to buy your coffee in a disposable cup, which they ironically fill with more milk (thereby ruining their otherwise great cappucino's). Yet another example for the price you pay for trying to be more Eco-concious and saving the Earth from an extra paper cup. Love the coffee but must say 'no!' to this ridiculous and harmful policy.

The lychee gelato was dilizioso! I let each scoop melt on my tongue so I could enjoy every ounce of it. 1 scoop for $5.50 better be worth it!

Nicole loved the iced mocha drink so much that she shelled out $7.50 for it. On two occasions. They must have shipped that coffee in directly from Italy.

It's Vegas. INDULGE!

Beautiful space with comfy leather banquette if you're eating in. I had an outstanding cappuccino and a ham and mozzarella panini.  It had fresh basil which I liked. It was pretty good but I wouldn't say 5 stars, esp considering these items totaled $20. 

No question I would come back for the cappuccino.
The watermelon gelato was heavenly and very refreshing but it also cost an arm and a leg....$4 for ONE scoop!! what a rip off. So go if you're willing to splurge on gelato.

Very disappointed, I ordered a latte and didn't like the taste and asked the server what type of milk he used and he was very rude. And didn't want to answer my question.  I will not go back since the service was very bad.

I heart good espresso as much as I heart good cocktails - and this place does not disappoint.  Illy has an extensive menu of every different type of espresso based drink you could imagine.  On my recent trip I sampled a latte and "espresso macchiato" - both were perfectly pulled and tasted incredible (the espresso almost tastes like there is cocoa in it because it is so rich and the texture is like velvet on your tongue - wow, that is a bit porno, but it is true, totally orgasmic).

As a tip, we tried to order the latte with skim milk and were (sweetly) told that they recommend whole or 2% milk with their espresso...so we added the fat and enjoyed every second of it.

Since we were adding fat anyway, we also tried two gelatos and both were fantastic.  Order smalls because they are seriously packed with flavor!

The prices are high, but I would hit this place again in a minute!

I love me gelato even thought I don't get it often. This location has plenty of selection to choose from and I mean plenty! You will spend way too much time trying to decide which flavor to get. No joke. You might even ruin your vacation wasting time. 

The gelato is top notch. Has the mixed berry and mango and every single bite was pure bliss. I was already full from dinner, but I kept going. 

Only downside is the price as I paid almost $9 bucks for two scoops. No joke. Still a great location with great food.

I love this coffee!!!!!!  The staff was friendly and knowledgeable...The location is great...The food was Fab....Wish I found it on my first day of my LV trip instead of my last........Go here or don't drink coffee...That is all.....
$7 for a mocha?! Not worth it!

A go-to spot for pre or post shopping refreshment. There are limited choices for non-alcoholic drinks near the Palazzo shops. They have a good selection of beverages and snacks. The coffee drinks are executed well, but I always find myself slurping on my straw too soon. In other words, the drinks are small. If you're getting refreshment on the rocks, ask for light ice to counter this sad fact.
Like Cafe Presse, it's a good spot for some joe or espresso drinks.  Those with a sweet tooth will enjoy the selection of gelato here too.

@ the Palazzo

After finding out the "overpriced Valentine's weekend" price 
and the line for the gondola rides
we walked around taking pictures
and came across this nicely set up place.
And of course the ladies wanted some gelato~

one scoop of gelato/sorbet = $5.50
holy crap!

I had pistachio
and my bf had cappuccino http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/HnbkGxUs7oWKYDeB-Pk82Q?select=JQ7yChi5Vs9JTMZBhnn1Gg..
both were extra creamy that 
after a couple licks and bites here and there
I got sick of it and didn't finish eating it. :P
(good thing we only got 1 scoop each x])
and they give you this tiny red "spoon"
the same one they give you for tasting.. o.O

They also have crepes, sammiches, and other desserts
we didn't bother getting 'cause we had a BIG lunch..
maybe next time? :P

The new holiday latte, Chestnut latte and Sweet and Spiced, are so much better than the sugary mint ones at Starbucks.  This cafe serves more than great coffee! It includes lucious sweets and light lunches as well.  My visit here did not disappoint and is definitely my go to place for coffee in Yorkdale now.

The store is located on the second level in the new food court area and it has a great open space that allows you to look down onto the 'courtyard' lobby.  Seating is not so plentiful but it's secluded from the large food court so it's quieter in addition to being cleaner.  When we went, it was 90% filled around 1 pm.  There isn't a traditional waitstaff but they do take away your dishes and clean the tables quite thoroughly when you're ready to leave.

I ordered a Chestnut latte, a chocolate croissant, cannoli (small), americano, and a hot chocolate for our small group.  I should have order more food as someone devoured the cannoli in under a minute. She normally doesn't like cannoli's as they're filled with cream (instead of ricotta) and just overloaded with sugar with a soggy crust.  The textures and overheightened sweetness puts her off.  This cannoli is possibly the best cannoli I've had out of a mall.  The cannoli had that great shatter of a freshly made shell.  It wasn't too hard from being over fried but had that perfect balance of crispiness without being too thick and crunchy.  The filling was REAL ricotta cheese!  What a pleasant surprise.  It had that nice light tangy taste but was lightly sweetened.  I grabbed a mini bite before my toddler took everything of it.  The chocolate croissant was also very nice.  Buttery, crispy and shattered lightly under a small bite, and good amount of dark chocolate inside.  The hot chocolate was more chocolate than sugar (yay!) and the latte I had was wonderful.  A warm nuttiness was the perfect compliment to the low acidity but bold coffee flavour.  It played wonderfully with my usual caffiene requirement and makes me wish they kept it the entire year.  The americano was fantastic as well.  It wasn't overly water, wasn't bitter or heavily acidic, and had a great bold flavour that you'd expect.

This place is more expensive than Tim Horton's but I feel the flavours and quality is significantly higher than your average mall fare.  I will come back over and over to try their seasonal flavours since they're unique (no usual pumpkin spice or candy cane flavours) and have lots of nice little treats to savour.  I highly recommend this place!

This is a wonderful little coffee shop at the intersection of The Venetian and Palazzo.  If your in the Canal shops at the end of Palazzo just go down the escalator and it's on your right.  

They have a ton of different espresso, cappuccino and coffee drinks as well as breakfast items, sandwiches and gelato's.   

The service was quick and the coffee items are all excellent.  I'm a happy camper that this is just a short walk from our room. 

Enjoy!

I love illy coffee, but here it takes a year to get an $8 latte, and you line up regardless of how many customers they have. 

Why? 

Slowest fucking coffee makers in the world.

Good news is, there are only 3 customers. I may get out of here with a latte in under 20 min.

This is my go-to spot for liquid crack.. and by liquid crack I mean their delicious, perfectly made, espresso macchiatos. The balance of steamed milk and freshly ground illy espresso bean is the ideal fix to wake me up, keep me going, or make me sober again. I felt that the staff put great effort into crafting the cup the way it should be crafted: with ease, patience, and style. Great experience indeed!

Delicious, but terribly expensive gelato. I'd make comparisons to gelato in Berkeley but that's not fair since everything costs a limb in Vegas.

For $5.50 you can have one scoop of gelato. Their flavors are great, however, with an abundant variety. Take advantage of the samples to narrow down your choice unless you want to pay nearly $8 for two scoops.

The staff here could use some cheering up, however, lest  I feel like I'm making their day shitty by ordering a gelato on a hot summer day.

====

Rubric: 5 = Mindblowing 4 = Excellent 3 = I see the charm 2 = Disappointing 1 = Never again

Coffee tastes burnt. My hot drink was served in a plastic cup so I had them remake it which they gave me SO MUCH ATTITUDE about- why would you put hot fluids in thin plastic? It releases cancer-causing agents! Absolutely ludicrous. This place is disgusting.

Booooo! Two thumbs down. $5 for plain black coffee. It's not even as good as the organic gourmet coffees I make at home. The apple crepe was nasty. I've never seen them use raw cold Granny Smith apples at any other creperie. I had to return it cuz I couldn't even eat it.
Sandwich was good, but chips and salad that came with it were worthless.  Service was very slow, and employees didn't seem to care.

We came here because we saw a guy eating a banana split and it looked so good! We get there and the lady behind the counter just stared at us. Guy came over and asked what we want. I didn't like the banana split because they used gelato instead of ice cream. Not a good combo... Also, the workers were not friendly at all. One lady was staring at me the whole time. Weirdo...  Never again.

Came here to use the last of our resort credit on a gelato. 

The prices are ridiculously high, but that's Vegas right? 

The gelato wasn't as smooth as it should have been at 6.00+ dollars for a small, European style scoop. 

I would go to another gelato place before coming here

Oh my goodness! Best coffee and espresso, ever! We come here for coffee every morning and in the afternoon for a quick pick me up whenever we're in Vegas.  Just amazing, great quality coffee/espresso drinks served here.  Oh, and they also serve gelato and paninis.

Came in for a wrap, panini, some dessert and coffee. Wrap and panini bread were all too hard. Pecan pie and opera cake were too sweet and not very fresh. Only decent thing was the ice coffee. Will not come back for food items again.
Worst $7 I've spent on a cappuccino. The service was terrible and they charge extra if u want it for here. Go elsewhere terrible place.

I always get an americano and their classic cannoli - haven't found a better cannoli yet and they always sell out of them. They also carry some gluten free/wheat free treats too that are good. I haven't had any of the food so I can't comment on that part but definitely a great place for a coffee and sweets!

Wondering around Dine 3 at Yorkdale Mall looking for lunch options. Then I see Espressamente Illy's Happy Hour Deal, I know what and where I going to have dessert and coffee afterwards!

$5 Monday to Friday from 3 pm to 6 pm with a choice of either cappuccino or caffe latte with a cannolo sicilano. 

Great cappuccino: milk frothed perfectly and velvety smooth. such a pretty latte art too!

The cannoli is decent, I had better but the filling here is smooth and the crust has just the right crunch!

"Patio" area is nice with plenty of seating to hang for awhile or just have a quick coffee break. The cream cushions on the sofa does need cleaning as there are tons of coffee stains on them!!

This tantalizing cafe is filled with delicious coffee and dessert options! It's hard to select what to order, but since I wanted some coffee for our long drive back to LA, I got the iced "Cappucino Fredo Shakerato" ($5.85). I was initially shell-shocked by the prices, but then I realized I really shouldn't be. Considering that it's on prime real estate in Vegas, as well as one of the few actual "coffee shops" on the strip, the Sin City inflation should've been accounted for.

The cappuccino itself was delicious! Sweet, but not offensively so, and very strong! I was running on 10.5 hours of sleep throughout 3 nights in Vegas, and this cup of coffee (it only comes in one size - 16oz) managed to keep me awake during the brutal car ride. 

I really wished I got a chance to try their desserts, but at least I know where to go the next time I'm in town!
Excellent cappuccino! Mild but flavorful. Great foam! If you want a nice cup to have it in though, state its "for here". Otherwise you get a paper cup.

Waited at the usual counter for 10 minutes without acknowledgment because the barista dude was too rude to look up. Then the dork behind the counter says we have a new line on the other side. Wtf? Why do I bother coming here?!
Good coffee but people working here are rather rude and don't seem too interested in being there.

Hmm....I ordered their breakfast crossiant sandwich, and it seriously tasted like I made it at home. Nothing fancy about it. Even their grilled chicken panini ($12) wasn't as great as I would have thought; the bread (I believe it's ciabatta?) was a little too hard for me.

The gelato was pretty good with a wide selection of choices; I had their pistachio (the best I've had) and lychee (which was mediocre, as it had flavor initially but lost it towards the end). If I was just rating the gelato, I would probably give this place 4 stars...

Love this little spot in the Palazzo!  The gelato is some of the best I have ever had and there are endless amounts of delicious flavors. I went with the Sugar Free Mango and it was amazing. It was fresh and tasted just like I was eating a mango. The coffee looked and smelled great but had to pass this time around. $5.50 for one scoop but it was plentiful. Certainly would return!

illy is an Italian brand coffee bean. We got cappuccinos and iced lattes here and both were excellent. Non of that Starbucks crap but you also pay more for it. 

Their patio seating looking down at the Yorkdale mall is great. Spacious, comfortable, and a nice area to take a sitting break and catch up with friends and family.

I came here every morning to have their ham, egg and cheese on a toasted croissant. I know, I'm weird, but it was sooooo good! I also loved that they had fresh squeezed OJ. 

Also, if you don't come here for breakfast I do highly recommend this drink called the "That's Amore". OMG! Heaven in a cup.

Excellent coffee, and a good representation of what coffee is like in Italy, but do not charge me 75cents per ORDER for dine-in. That was pure ridiculous. You do pay a little more to dine in in Italy/France as well, but NOT 75cents per drinks...Plus, you already charged me $5 for a cappuccino and $4 for an espresso, and those alone cost half of that in Europe.

If it weren't for the prices, this place would earn the full 5 stars.

Crepe felt too "heavy," but the ingredients appeared fresh.  
Espresso was not impressive, and for the price they charged I expected a little more.  The balance was off, and it was slightly to high on the acidic scale for me.
 
Overall, will probably not be a repeat customer...

A bit overpriced for what it is, the margherita pizza I ordered here nonetheless did the trick when I needed a quick, innocuous bite to eat while hungover on the Sunday of a bachelor party weekend in Vegas.  Weigh my rating accordingly.

My husband and I wanted a quick bite before our morning gondola ride at the Venetian. Unfortunately, we picked this place...

First of all, the staff was incredibly rude. They acted like we were bothering them by placing an order. Seriously? And don't you dare ask a question - you'll get some eye rolls. Dude, this is Vegas and you work in the restaurant industry, you should probably learn to deal with people.

We shared a chocolate croissant and my husband got a coffee. Our total was 12$ - not even kidding. The croissant was dry and tiny. For the price we paid, I expected something at least decent.

If the staff was friendlier, I wouldn't have been moved to write a review on this place (despite the high prices and lousy food) because it was just a quick breakfast, but you have far better options nearby. Don't waste your time, money, and calories on this place.
The affagato was sweet and creamy! Two scoops of your choice gelato and two shots of espresso :)

My review is only for the coffee - I did not try the gelatos (there were none out yet at 8am), or any of the pastries. We were staying at the Palazzo, so I had to try this place out. They open at 6am, so if you're awake that early (or haven't slept yet), this is the place to go. I had the cappuccino (my tummy can't handle the lactose in the lattes anymore), and it was delicious. No bitterness to it - it didn't need sugar or anything. The caffeine buzz from it was perfect as well, no jitters or heart palpitations. It also helps to be drinking it within the beauty that is the Shoppes of the Palazzo... Give it a try ;)

Gelato galore! Crunchy Rum was my favorite, I tasted the Guava and although it was good (it's an acquired taste) it was too sweet. If you're in a group and don't mind taste testing what each had, that's an ideal situation. The service was slow, it could be better. They really should have more people scooping ice cream, 1 doesn't cut it.
Be careful. The cashier upgrades your beverage to large without asking. I paid $7.00 for a chai latte!!!!!! I love tea but that's a bit overboard.

charged my friend for food when they run out of basically everything in the menu, they dont even apologize for any of their mistake? not to mention their menu doesnt even stay up to date on the time for food availability.. worst experience ever

crepes, gelato and coffee is really good here!!!!!!!

i love this place and everytime im at palazzo i stop here!
great location. sweet staff, fast service, great gelato and espresso. my only comment is 2 scoops of ice cream and an espresso cost me $19 but i'm in vegas lol!

Yes it's sleek and beautiful, but the staff was totally bored and unexciting for a new espresso/gelato shop like this.  The quality of the gelato, although presented beautifully, was only average, and the prices are a bit much, even by Vegas standards.  Instead, I'll burn a few calories taking a hike over to Caesar's and pig out at Payard Patisserie!

The line to place your order is poorly organized. I jumped in and being new to the place I missed the whole right side of the shop: display cases with yummy looking pastries and the menu.  So not knowing all my options I just got a sundae- which was good, 3 scoops. I just wish I could have seen it all before I ordered.

freaking expensive but sooo freaking good! never had a better pistacio gelato! yes,yes, 6 bucks for 1 scoop but its really awesome! the hazelnut comes in second.  can't wait to try the sorbet next! oh and free wifi for customers!

Food: We saw the huge selection of gelato from upstairs and we couldn't wait to get down there to try some! The straciatella was great and all the other gelato flavors looked just as delicious.

Price: A bit pricey, I believe I paid around $11 for each of us to get 1 scoop.

Service: Definitely was crowded in here but we got in and out of here pretty fast.

Atmosphere: There are a few places to sit and eat but we decided to head out since there were alot of people in here.

Location: Located in the Palazzo downstairs at the shops. Near the waterfall.

Rather than wait in a line that was 20 people deep at The Coffee Bean inside The Palazzo, I decided to venture a few steps further and grabbed my morning jolt from Espressamente.  

Although my pastry seemed a bit dry, it was still good and my Americana stole the show.  It was strong, but not too strong and the perfect way to start my day.  

They had a beautiful (and very colorful) display of gelato, but I never made it back to try any.  

Next time!
Very tasty coffee.  Fabulous coffee concoction menu.  Delightful service... so friendly and willing to make tweaks as necessary.  Perfect stop for a quick pick-me-up before a 10:30 pm show!

I have to say that the set-up to this place is a bit bananas. A long display case of gelato greets you, there is a center counter where they ring you up and occasionally take your order, and then more display case. Seeing as how everyone visiting Vegas is always a little confused, the lack of direction here seems to be a bit of an issue. Alas, I like this place a lot, even though it's full of confused patrons.

My order was taken for a double espresso. The counter staff was energetic and efficient. The very handsome Italian man who was making my drink even took the time to ask if I wanted to enjoy my double shot in a cup *for here* because, let's be serious, nobody likes espresso in a paper cup.

The espresso was creamy and smooth. A perfect sippable snack that is just in need of a gelato sidekick.
Not up to illy's standards! Worst service we've experienced in years.  If you mess up on an order twice, and don't offer a refund, that's horrible customer service.
Fabulous Mocha coffee, just right. Their chocolate mousse bomb was light and not sweet like the Europeans like it. Great modern decor, really helpful staff, a delightful place.

I always stop in for a quick pick-me-up when I'm walking between the Venetian and Palazzo.  I'll get either an espresso or affogato.  They have a great selection  of gelato from which to choose.  Those are great tasting and offer you opportunities to any any of these flavors in your affogato.

Located in the Yorkdale mall on the first landing going to their food court stands this coffee place - right on top of Coach.

I've been here off and on for a good cup of coffee and some dessert when I feel that I deserve a sugar rush - oh yeah!

Chic, modern, and terribly busy.  Seating inside the place and out on their pseudo-patio is at a premium most of the time.

Price is high but the coffee is nice and their lattes are better than most places in the mall.  Their desserts are really good - the new wave of colourful macaroons are very popular.  I don't understand when the chewy baked coconut morsels lost it's name to the cookie like dessert.  Go figure.

After running around the mall battling insane shoppers and tourists.  It's a nice haven to get into la dolce vita!

Cheers.
Love illy coffee. Fresh delicious tasting gelato and a friendly staff. I stop here before work inside the casino often and find it a perfect start to my mornings

This place needs some work in regards to their operations. It literally took more than 20 minutes to get my crepe. Other customers had the same issue. They should have someone dedicated to that station or at least a backup as they did have employees standing around while we all waited. Also, they needed to make more crepe mix - why would they not be making more while they served crepes in the middle of a day during a busy holiday weekend? The coffee was served quickly but everything else took forever. The crepe really wasn't very good either, I didn't even eat half. My friend's affogato was good though - although she did say the coffee was very strong. I would not recommend this spot if you plan to get anything other than coffee.

As an Aussie and a new local I'm still finding my way around Las Vegas. I'm particularly picky when it comes to coffee and to be quite honest I haven't had a decent coffee in Las Vegas since I've been here until a few days ago,my husband and I drove into the strip to see a show and we stopped here for a quick pre show snack. The coffee was made perfectly as a proper cappuccino should be, so good in fact I had two. We also purchased two crpes which were amazing. I just wish it was closer and I'd be here daily for my caffeine hit.

Perfect pick me up spot after a long day of shopping or gambling. I went for the Amore, which was a bit pricey ($5+) but was very refreshing and unique: an Italian take on an Irish Coffee (sans alcohol). It was refreshing while also sweet. 

I've also never seen such an array of gelato flavor options. Gotta try them all.
